globalcompanydescription.__cdata:
We started our journey seven years ago with Dropbox, a magic folder to keep your stuff safe. But as we've built Dropbox and seen how it's helped millions around the world, that magic folder has become something much more - a home for life.


Technology should 'just work' and make us happy. But with all the different apps, devices, and data out there, stuff gets complicated pretty quickly. Today, over 500 million (and growing!) people across every continent rely on Dropbox to get stuff done.


Our team has barely scratched the surface, and we're building much more than a little blue box. That's why we're assembling an incredible team to craft the solutions that'll simplify technology for the world - and we're just getting started.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description

Our Sales team shares Dropbox for Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

The education industry represents a key market for Dropbox for Business and is already one of the top verticals for Dropbox. Some of the most recognized colleges and universities in the world, school districts, and primary schools already have meaningful numbers of Dropbox users who rely on the service to be more productive. We are looking for experienced Account Executives to help us take our education success to the next level.

Responsibilities

  • Sell Dropbox for Business to the education industry- with special emphasis on the college and university and school district segments
  • Full-cycle sales with responsibility for building and maintaining a pipeline of prospective and current customer deals
  • Drive market awareness and cultivate a well-respected brand across the education industry for Dropbox for Business
  • Help build the vertical business case and achieve quarterly forecasts for Education initiatives, pipeline development, sales
  • Target new customers and to develop strong relationships with clients in the education industry, with particular emphasis on the college market, large school districts, and international institutions
  • Evaluate opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, sales, and retention within a book of business
  • Deliver product demos, provide insightful technical answers, and recommend creative ways to get the most out of Dropbox for Business
  • Work cross-functionally with Lead Generation, Account Management, and Solutions Architecture teams
  • Be the voice of the customer to the product team
  • Help scale processes including lead generation, presentation, negotiation, recruiting, and more
  • Find comfort in working in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead by example through perseverance, humility, and initiative
  • Delight every Dropbox user with each interaction
  • Believe no task is too small, and no task is too tall

Requirements

  • 5+ years of direct selling experience to CIO's and IT Directors of higher educational institutions and community colleges
  • Top performer in previous sales roles
  • Prior experience at Internet or SaaS companies is a major plus
  • Passionate about revolutionizing the way people collaborate
  • Avid Dropbox user
  • Bachelorï¿½'s degree
  • US work authorization

Job Description

Acquisition Manager EMEA

London, England
Â 
Team DescriptionÂ 
Â 
Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights, and maximize our products' potential.
Â 
Role Description
Â 
We are looking for an experienced Acquisition Manager with a passion for driving brand and business growth through customer acquisition and re-engagement in a cost effective manner. Working with multiple internal departments, youâll be responsible for the strategy, execution, and analysis of performance marketing activities. Youâll play a key role in delivering on the overall marketing strategy while creating and optimizing digital marketing plans that grow Dropbox Pro and Dropbox Business.Â 
Â 
Responsibilities
  • Lead the testing, development and execution of digital marketing (paid search, retargeting, display, SEO, et al.) that directly impact awareness, engagement, and acquisition in key European markets
  • Constant analysis of data to identify areas of improvement/optimization and to ensure maximum ROI
  • Generate regular (weekly and monthly) performance reports for distribution within the marketing team and broader organization.
  • Identify and manage in-region performance marketing agencies
  • Work with the broader Acquisition, EMEA marketing, and Localization teams to optimize our paid, earned, and owned media touchpoints to maximize conversion
  • Work closely with our Conversion and Analytics teams to develop hypothesis and measure results of performance experiments
Â 
Requirements
  • 5+ years experience in online/digital marketing, performance marketing. Solid brand strategy experience a plus
  • Expertise in at least one channel, and working knowledge across others: Facebook ads, Adwords, LinkedIn, Twitter ads, affiliate marketing, SEO, SEM, programmatic display, retargeting etc
  • Excellent analytical, communication, and organizational skills
  • Expertise in Excel and and familiarity with other analytical tools (SQL, SPSS, Stata, R) and reporting (Google Analytics, Tableau) tools.
  • Past experience in highly analytical work, such as investment banking, finance, economics desired
  • English fluency and eligible to work in E.U

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Admin team works magic behind the scenes to keep Dropbox teams running smoothly. We help teams thrive by prioritizing and anticipating needs even before they arise.

Role Description

We are looking for a sharp, good-humored Administrative Assistant who enjoys working in a constantly changing environment and streamlining a hectic day. You will primarily provide dedicated administrative assistance to several team leads while also providing general support to the leads' team at large. You will be working in a fast-paced, creative environment with passionate team members who are focused on quality and execution. If you like to tame chaos while remaining calm and flexible in the face of ever-changing priorities and needs, then this is the role for you.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Coordinate both internal and external conference calls, meetings, and events
  • Heavy calendar management in a rapidly and ever-changing environment
  • Plan and execute on-site and off-site meetings, dinners, and events
  • Prepare monthly expense reports for leads and coordinate special projects as needed
  • Set up travel and accommodations for executives or visitors coming to Dropbox
  • Serve as the face of Dropbox on behalf of your leads and help them build great relationships with internal stakeholders and external contacts

Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • 2-4 years experience in an administrative support role with startup and/or experience in a hyper-growth organization preferred
  • Experience with heavy calendaring for multiple principals or teams
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities at once
  • Ability to move quickly and make on-the-spot decisions without sacrificing attention to detail
  • Track record of consistently going above and beyond
  • Great communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a spectrum of personalities
  • Strong Excel, PowerPoint, and Google e-mail/calendar/doc skills
  • Ability to maintain composure and sense of humor in high-pressure situations
  • Passion for Dropbox and helping your leads and their team as it scales

Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. 500 million people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go.   • US work authorization

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

The Business Marketing team drives the messaging and content that reaches prospective customers of our business products and influences their decision to purchase. By communicating our vision, addressing common misconceptions, sales blockers, and revenue opportunities, we change perceptions of the value Dropbox can deliver for businesses, small and large.

Role Description

As part of the Business Marketing team, you will be responsible for driving consideration for Dropbox Business through world-class storytelling. Your goal is to inspire and engage the IT community across all segments, SMB to enterprise, about future of work. The ideal candidate is equal parts storyteller and business strategist, has the ability to turn data into actionable insights. This position will work closely with product marketing, acquisition marketing, design, and product management teams to craft compelling stories about Dropbox Business and execute on strategies that will bring these stories to life.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Drive consideration and intent for Dropbox Business through multi-channel campaigns (affecting targeting, positioning, messaging, creative, and launch)
  • Conduct segment, market, and competitive researchâboth qualitative and quantitativeâto better understand full-funnel marketing trends and apply key learning to new initiatives
  • Analyze performance metrics to refine our campaign distribution strategy (channel prioritization, budget, and testing cadence)
  • Collaborate with key cross-functional partners to develop campaigns and content, test messaging and communicate insights
  • Identify new opportunities to use content to engage with our audience and let the world know that Dropbox is the best place to get work done

Requirements

  • Understanding and appreciation for full-funnel, multi-channel marketing; marketing experience a plus but not required
  • Exceptional storytelling and communication skills (written, verbal, and visual)
  • Teamwork and collaboration: Ability to foster strong working relationships with team members and cross-functional partners
  • Self-starter and ability to build programs from scratch: be ready to roll-up your sleeves and take ownership
  • Comfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a dynamic business landscape
  • Interest in SaaS/enterprise software industry and trends

We also work with external partners across the tech ecosystem to develop new innovative growth strategies for Dropbox.Role DescriptionAs part of the Business Strategy & Operations team, you will work closely with the executive team to set our strategy, drive key business initiatives, and effect change across the company. Example activities are emerging market strategies, business plans for new growth opportunities, partnership strategies, and special situation projects for the executive team and board of directors.In your role, you will work alongside other functions such as product & design, engineering, sales,marketing, business development and finance. Depending on your tenure, you will drive projects and run cross-functional teams independently.We are a fast growing company and you will have the opportunity to roll-up your sleeves and help the company move from strategy to execution.ResponsibilitiesWork in partnership with Dropbox executive leadership to identify scalable business opportunities, then help build operational plans to execute against these opportunitiesWork with existing or potential strategic partners and startups to identify future creative growth opportunities to craft Dropboxâ growth trajectoryDevelop a deep understanding of Dropboxâs business operations, including internal processes, functional group strategies, and competitive contextBuild strong peer-level relationships with Dropbox senior management across the business and engineering organizationsWork with cross-functional teams to help guide initial implementation of strategic plansCommunicate findings to senior management and to the broader organizationHelp mentor junior team membersRequirementsAt least 3 years experience in management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or in strategy from a leading tech company; experience with a rapidly scaling business is a plusStrong relationship-building skills and experience working closely with senior executivesExcellent communication skills with the aptitude to distil complex issues and detailed analysis into simple, structured frameworks with concrete action plansDemonstrated experience and excellence in driving complex and cross-functional projects with multiple partnersHighly analytical and able to extract business insights from analysis; strong financial modeling or statistical analytical skills are a plusPractical business sense with the ability to translate between strategic business decisions and their operational implicationsComfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a dynamic business landscapeLow ego attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level critical thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teamsBachelorâs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

The Business Strategy & Operations team partners with Dropboxâs leadership team and operational leaders to drive key strategic initiatives, address critical business challenges, and develop and execute strategies that drive opportunities in Dropboxâs business. We also work with external partners across the tech ecosystem to develop new innovative growth strategies for Dropbox.Â 

Role Description

As part of the Business Strategy & Operations team, you will work closely with the executive team to set our strategy, drive key business initiatives, and effect change across the company. Example activities are emerging market strategies, business plans for new growth opportunities, partnership strategies, and special situation projects for the executive team and board of directors.
In your role, you will work alongside other functions such as product & design, engineering, sales,marketing, business development and finance. You will also work with existing or potential strategic partners and startups to identify future innovative growth opportunities for Dropbox. Depending on your tenure, you will drive projects and run cross-functional teams independently.
We are a fast growing company and you will have the opportunity to roll-up your sleeves and help the company move from strategy to execution.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Work in partnership with Dropbox executive leadership to identify scalable business opportunities, then help build operational plans to execute against these opportunities
  • Work with existing or potential strategic partners and startups to identify future creative growth opportunities to craft Dropboxâ growth trajectory
  • Develop a deep understanding of Dropboxâs business operations, including internal processes, functional group strategies, and competitive context
  • Build strong peer-level relationships with Dropbox senior management across the business and engineering organizations
  • Work with cross-functional teams to help guide initial implementation of strategic plans
  • Communicate findings to senior management and to the broader organization
  • Help mentor junior team members

Requirements

  • At least 3 years experience in management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or in strategy from a leading tech company; experience with a rapidly scaling business is a plusÂ 
  • Strong relationship-building skills and experience working closely with senior executives
  • Excellent communication skills with the aptitude to distil complex issues and detailed analysis into simple, structured frameworks with concrete action plans
  • Demonstrated experience and excellence in driving complex and cross-functional projects with multiple partners
  • Highly analytical and able to extract business insights from analysis; strong financial modeling or statistical analytical skills are a plus
  • Practical business sense with the ability to translate between strategic business decisions and their operational implications
  • Comfort with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a dynamic business landscape
  • Low ego attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level critical thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams
  • Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field.

description.__cdata: Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.Our Tech Operations team crafts the layer from which all Dropbox experiences are built. Â 

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.
Â 
Our Tech Operations team crafts the layer from which all Dropbox experiences are built. As our user base and product family continues to grow, tech operations is responsible for strengthening our foundation.
Â 
Scale one of the largest storage capacities in the world: work with Product, Infrastructure, and Data Engineering teams to find the optimal way to scale the infrastructure. We have hundreds of millions of users, hundreds of petabytes of data, and thousands of giga bps of network flow. Welcome to one of the fastest growing Internet infrastructure services in the world!

Responsibilities

  • You will own end-to-end infrastructure support for product design, launch, and operations: support architecture design, define networking requirement, and help build code from scratch to support new product launch.
  • Solve the hardest software performance issues: work with software developers closely to improve code base performance (e.g. algorithm redesign), reduce resource consumption and shorten request latency.
  • Develop tools to monitor billions of user requests: you will write monitoring, reporting, data-mining tools to do performance and capacity-related tests and analysis.
  • Provide deep visibility to what is going on for all products: run capacity and performance experiments to determine scaling and utilization parameters for various service tiers.
  • Find the game changers and bring them on: you will work with financial analysts, operations and engineering to perform ground breaking technologies investigation and cost analysis.
  • A lot of other cool work: identify capacity-related issues and work with systems, network, application teams to discover resolutions.

Requirements

  • You have a MS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or other technical field preferred
  • Bachelor degree or equivalent is required for this role
  • You have experience working in extremely large-scale computing infrastructures
  • Strong coding and scripting ability (C, C++, Java, python or Go)
  • You hold solid database experience, MySQL preferred
  • Strong analytical, budgeting and planning skills
  • You use excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively across multiple teams

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • GenerousÂ vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox Customer Experience Team

Our mission in Dropbox is to simplify the way people work together. With a global user base of over 500 million, the Customer Experience team simplifies how our users and customers interact with Dropbox. We focus on understanding the customer journey as well as where we can simplify interactions and improve the Customer Experience.Â 
Â 

Role Description

We are seeking an experienced leader to develop and drive cross-functional programs that help transform our customer experience and create the building blocks for a customer-centric organization. Â 
Â 

Responsibilities

  • Develop a global program roadmap for CX team which will support our 3 year strategy.
  • Responsible for managing the overall global program roadmap, which will include projects owned by other project leads and in some cases this individual will own the end to end project himself/herself.Â 
  • Work closely with Decision Analytics, and CX and Global Business Operations Leadership Teams, to identify key priorities improve the Dropbox experience for our customers across functions, and act as project lead for those priorities.Â 
  • Liaise with key stakeholders across Engineering, Product, Marketing, Sales and Support at all levels to enlist support and buy-in on prioritized projects.Â 
  • Develop deep understanding of CX support operations and Dropbox customer journey to anticipate how to drive continuous improvement and strategic value add for our customer.
  • Advise the CX Leadership Team on timelines and sequences for key strategic programs, helping to prioritize for maximum impact.
  • Lead the effort to create project management excellence within CX.Â 
  • Managing project leads within the Dropbox CX organization.
Â 

RequirementsÂ 

  • Experienced Program Manager leader with at least 12 years experience, preferably in fast-paced, hyper-growth organizations combined with team growth and development.
  • Experience in CX or customer-facing functions - Ideal candidate must have a passion for creating great customer experiences and an understanding of the linkage between these experiences and business success.
  • Deep business operations expertise with demonstrated experience of operational skills translated into strategic business impact.
  • Proven ability to influence stakeholders across functional and global organizations.
  • Proven ability to work autonomously, successfully managing remote stakeholder relationships.
  • Skill at prioritizing and balancing multiple strategic projects.
  • Understanding of organizational dynamics, operating experience with large and complex organizations.
  • Excellent listening and persuading skills through written and verbal communication.
  • This role is based in San Francisco with some travel (10â20%) required.
  • PMP certification or equivalent preferred.
  • Advanced Business degree preferred.

And as we scale rapidly with our business growth, weâre hiring dedicated and enthusiastic people to help deliver compelling online support globally.
Â 
Role description
Â 
The CX Escalation Manager is responsible for managing the end-to-end customer escalation process, focusing reactively on customer issue resolution, and proactively on the prevention of similar escalations in the future. They work quickly and collaboratively to identify and assess the impact of critical customer issues. They will co-ordinate efforts across CX, the broader Dropbox organization, and our outsourcing partner to actively resolve or remediate those issues while managing internal communications and customers updates. Key responsibilities include:
Â 
  • Working collaboratively to identify and assess escalations â covering individual or groups ofcustomers â as well as defining the escalation process, de-escalation strategy and exit criteria
  • Co-ordinating resolution efforts across CX, Dropbox and outsourced provider
  • Implementing and managing the CX escalation process across Dropbox and its outsourced support provider
  • Co-ordinating internal and external communications during escalations, particularly with customer-facing teams such as Sales and Customer Success
  • Owning priority support and other Staff-level support requests on behalf of Dropboxâs customers
  • Co-ordinating root cause analysis / post-mortem discussions to eliminate or minimize the impact of similar escalations in the future.
  • BCP co-ordinator for CX
  • Co-ordinating cross functional responses to tools outages
Â 
Role requirements
  • 4+ yearâs experience in escalation or technical support management
  • Experience of leading customers through challenging issues to successful resolution
  • Ability to understand the business impact of customer support issues, and advocate for the customer in internal resourcing discussions
  • Strong communicator with specific experience of managing customer expectations and senior stakeholder communications
  • Demonstrated ability to resolve or drive resolution to critical situations through innovative solutions
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects while working cross-functionally in a fast paced environment
  • You have existing knowledge of Dropbox products
  • You are degree qualified in a technical or business discipline

As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.Your role and impactOur Tech Operations team crafts the layer from which all Dropbox experiences are built. As our user base and product family continues to grow, tech operations is responsible for strengthening our foundation.With the Datacenter Engineering team, you will be responsible for designing, building and optimizing the physical datacenters that Dropboxâs core infrastructure resides in. Â The Datacenter Engineering team lives inside of a tactical physical infrastructure organization with interleaving dependencies. As a result, the Datacenter Engineering team is a highly-interdisciplinary group informed by core building science, but heavily influenced by a thorough understanding interconnectivity, hardware, and operations at Dropbox.ResponsibilitiesWork with Capacity and Forecasting teams on physical resource consumptionPerform engineering calculations, basis of design and drawing packages for new datacenter projectsScope, bid, and contract the implementation of new facilitiesManage, QA/QC, and run project controls for ongoing projectsConceive, model and implement facility optimization projects within the serving environmentsEvaluate and test emerging technologies in datacenter building, controls and monitoringRequirementsA BS or BSE degree in a relevant engineering field3â5 years of experience in datacenter design, construction, and optimizationThorough theoretical and practical education of applied mechanical, electrical, and structured cabling systems in datacentersAutoCAD / Revit drawing production required and 3D Modeling experience preferredUnderstanding of server architecture highlighted with power delivery and heat rejection systemsPreferences towards CFD and power systems modelingBasic exposure to datacenter economics, accounting and cost modelingExperience with Linux systems and programming, CLI, and shellsis a plusImplementation knowledge of facility and server telemetry systems, sensoring, protocols, and data collection (ie: polling, aggregation, display, alarm, archive)is a plusBenefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks(technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Your role and impact

Our Tech Operations team crafts the layer from which all Dropbox experiences are built. As our user base and product family continues to grow, tech operations is responsible for strengthening our foundation.
Â 
With the Datacenter Engineering team, you will be responsible for designing, building and optimizing the physical datacenters that Dropboxâs core infrastructure resides in. Â The Datacenter Engineering team lives inside of a tactical physical infrastructure organization with interleaving dependencies. As a result, the Datacenter Engineering team is a highly-interdisciplinary group informed by core building science, but heavily influenced by a thorough understanding interconnectivity, hardware, and operations at Dropbox.

Responsibilities

  • Work with Capacity and Forecasting teams on physical resource consumption
  • Perform engineering calculations, basis of design and drawing packages for new datacenter projects
  • Scope, bid, and contract the implementation of new facilities
  • Manage, QA/QC, and run project controls for ongoing projects
  • Conceive, model and implement facility optimization projects within the serving environments
  • Evaluate and test emerging technologies in datacenter building, controls and monitoringÂ 

Requirements

  • A BS or BSE degree in a relevant engineering field
  • 3â5 years of experience in datacenter design, construction, and optimization
  • Thorough theoretical and practical education of applied mechanical, electrical, and structured cabling systems in datacenters
  • AutoCAD / Revit drawing production required and 3D Modeling experience preferred
  • Understanding of server architecture highlighted with power delivery and heat rejection systems
  • Preferences towards CFD and power systems modeling
  • Basic exposure to datacenter economics, accounting and cost modeling
  • Experience with Linux systems and programming, CLI, and shells is a plus
  • Implementation knowledge of facility and server telemetry systems, sensoring, protocols, and data collection (ie: polling, aggregation, display, alarm, archive) is a plus

Â Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)
Â 
Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Company Description
Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow weâre bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.
Â 
Team DescriptionÂ 
Dropbox is looking to become the industry leader in Data Science-driven sales. The Revenue Data Science team will deliver analytics and tools to drive revenue by combining the rich internal data across 500M+ Dropbox users and external data on buying patterns of prospects and customers.Â 
Â 
Roles and Responsibilities
  • Work on high priority initiatives including (but not limited to) account prioritization, account prospecting, and opportunity scoring.Â 
  • Instrumentation of propensity modeling: query and process big data: integrate volumes of data from multiple internal and external sources and into Dropboxâs systems of recordÂ 
  • Partner closely with data scientists to develop internal and external data sources to be used in propensity modeling and predictive analytics.
  • Implement propensity models into Dropboxâs revenue systems of record, track their effectiveness, analyze & report on findings.
  • Establish scaleable revenue prospecting initiatives using Dropbox internal dataÂ 
  • Conceptualize, design and build data-fueled insights to help Dropbox improve analytics for prospects and customers. Examples include:
    • Benchmarking: Develop comparative indexes that measure how companies compare to industry peers in key performance and usage metrics.
    • Recommendation engine: Use real-time analytics to recommend ways in which customers can maximize adoption and usage of Dropbox.Â 
  • Work closely with other team members and the business to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insight that provides performance improvement.
Â 
Â 
Requirements:
  • Masterâs Degree in computer science, applied statistics, economics, data mining, machine learning, or a related quantitative discipline
  • 5 - 8 years experience as strategic project/program lead in management consulting, B2B software (ideally SaaS) or a high-growth technology firm
  • Experience working with very large semi-structured data sets and integrating them into systems of record
  • Good SFDC skills and ability to develop analysis based on CRM data in a scalable manner
  • Ability to solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skills
  • Highly detailed-oriented and exceptional organizational and follow-through skills a must
  • Strong data-oriented scripting (e.g. SQL) and statistical programming (e.g., R or python)
  • Excellent judgment and creative problem solving skills
  • Excellent at planning and project management â ability to look ahead to meet regular deadlines and prevent last minute fire drills
  • Strong desire to take initiative; thrive on change and comfortable with ambiguity

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our legal, policy, trust & security team helps keep users and their stuff safe. We protect Dropbox, counsel Dropboxers on challenging problems, and deal with novel issues every day while standing up for users and helping the company and product grow.

Role Description

Protecting Dropbox and our users is essential to being worthy of trust. Weâre looking for an Data Security & Investigations ManagerÂ to join the Data Security team within Trust & Security. The Data Security team works to strengthen customer trust, manage security risks, and meet compliance obligations. This is an individual contributor, and you will work closely with counterparts in Risk and Compliance, Legal, and Security Engineering teams to help us keep Dropbox safe on a day-to-day basis. You will own internal investigations around policy violations and will work to mature our process and tools to help support these investigations. Â You will also oversee identity and data accesses controls for internal tools across the organization. You will assist with internal audits on a regular basis. Â Finally, you will support or manage various internal data security projects to help mature the data security program at Dropbox.
Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Manage and facilitate internal data security projects
  • Identify, review, and communicate data security best practices for the business
  • Manage the internal investigation program and lead all investigations.
  • Improve our detection and audit capabilities
  • Continuously improve and update our data access policies, roles, permissions and audit capabilities
  • Identify deviations from policy and take appropriate action

Requirements

  • 5+ years of data security, audit, or IT experience
  • Strong experience writing analytics queries and working within analytics tools
  • Expertise with standing up an investigation program, including selecting, implementing, and managing investigation tools
  • Experience conducting internal audits
  • Subject matter expertise on the best security practices across the data security industry
  • Understanding and willingness to learn about diverse business functionsÂ 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Passion for technology and desire to solve complex problems with creative solutions
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well in fast-paced team environment
  • Process-focused with strong track record of creating processes that scale

description.__cdata: Team Description - Our Sales team shares Dropbox for Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.Dropbox is looking to become the industry leader in Data Science-driven sales. The Revenue Data Science team will deliver analytics and tools to drive revenue by combining the rich internal data across 500M+ Dropbox users and external data on buying patterns of prospects and customers.Roles and ResponsibilitiesUse machine learning to research, design, implement, and validate leading-edge propensity models to analyze large scale network collaboration(e.g., 500M+ users) and micro-segment prospects and customers alike. Examples include:Account prioritization: segmenting and scoring account lists using propensity-to-buy models that combine Dropbox and external data sourcesAccount prospecting: generating scaleable analytics & models that link Dropbox data with company characteristics to create sales pipelineOpportunity scoring: using Bayesian modeling to generate regularly-updating sales opportunity scoresConceptualize, design and build data-fueled insights to help Dropbox improve analytics for prospects and customers. Examples include:Benchmarking: Develop comparative indexes that measure how companies compare to industry peers in key performance and usage metricsPredictive modeling: Build lead scoring algorithms to prioritize and time when account team should engage with which customersRecommendation engine: Use real-time analytics to recommend ways in which customers can maximize adoption and usage of DropboxRequirements:PhD or Masterâs Degree in computer science, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, or a related quantitative discipline8+ years of experience delivering world-class data science outcomesAbility to solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skillsHighly detailed-oriented and exceptional organizational and follow-through skills a mustStrong data-oriented scripting(e.g. SQL) and statistical programming(e.g., R or python)Excellent judgment and creative problem solving skillsEntrepreneurial team player who can multitaskExceptional written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with senior management and staff

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description

Our Sales team shares Dropbox for Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.
Â 
Â 
Dropbox is looking to become the industry leader in Data Science-driven sales. The Revenue Data Science team will deliver analytics and tools to drive revenue by combining the rich internal data across 500M+ Dropbox users and external data on buying patterns of prospects and customers.Â 
Â 
Roles and Responsibilities
  • Use machine learning to research, design, implement, and validate leading-edge propensity models to analyze large scale network collaboration (e.g., 500M+ users) and micro-segment prospects and customers alike. Examples include:
    • Account prioritization: segmenting and scoring account lists using propensity-to-buy models that combine Dropbox and external data sources Â 
    • Account prospecting: generating scaleable analytics & models that link Dropbox data with company characteristics to create sales pipeline
    • Opportunity scoring: using Bayesian modeling to generate regularly-updating sales opportunity scores Â 
  • Conceptualize, design and build data-fueled insights to help Dropbox improve analytics for prospects and customers. Examples include:
    • Benchmarking: Develop comparative indexes that measure how companies compare to industry peers in key performance and usage metrics
    • Predictive modeling: Build lead scoring algorithms to prioritize and time when account team should engage with which customers
    • Recommendation engine: Use real-time analytics to recommend ways in which customers can maximize adoption and usage of Dropbox

Requirements:

  • PhD or Masterâs Degree in computer science, applied statistics, data mining, machine learning, or a related quantitative discipline
  • 8+ years of experience delivering world-class data science outcomes
  • Ability to solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches with a unique blend of analytical, mathematical and technical skills
  • Highly detailed-oriented and exceptional organizational and follow-through skills a must
  • Strong data-oriented scripting (e.g. SQL) and statistical programming (e.g., R or python)
  • Excellent judgment and creative problem solving skills
  • Entrepreneurial team player who can multitask
  • Exceptional written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills and the ability to effectively interface with senior management and staff

description.__cdata: Team Description - On our People Team, we use an analytical, data-driven approach to solve problems, build programs, and help Dropboxers constantly improve upon how they work. The mission of the People Team is to delight and develop Dropbox. We believe people do their best work when theyâre happy, so we work to make Dropbox a place where everyone can thrive.Role DescriptionIn this role, you willbe responsible for overseeing all Diversity Recruiting efforts at Dropbox. Â 
Role Description

You will oversee the design and reporting on our Diversity hiring across various functions: Engineering, Business, G&A, and University. You will also work closely with sourcers, recruiters, and event teams to broaden our Diverse pipeline. Â

Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description
Â 
Every Dropboxer plays a key role in helping us find and recruit amazing people, and our recruiting team leads the charge by coordinating these efforts. Itâs no easy task to identify and attract the top talent in the world, but when you have the support of the entire company, itâs incredibly fun and rewarding. Thatâs what makes recruiting at Dropbox special.Â 
Â 
Weâre looking for a Diversity Sourcer to join our world-class GBO and G&A recruiting teams. You will help us tell the Dropbox story to a diverse audience and play an active role in building the pipeline of future Dropboxers. If youâre a team player with an eye for talent who loves connecting people and opportunities, this is the role for you.
Â 

Responsibilities

  • Partner with recruiters and hiring managers to deeply understand current (and future) hiring needs
  • Design and execute on strategies for identifying and engaging active and passive diverse candidates
  • Take an active role in defining and iterating on customized diversity sourcing strategies for business functions/teams across GBO and G&A
  • Create a process to leverage the networks of Dropboxers and drive diverse referrals
  • Deliver qualified diverse pipelines for active roles, as well as proactively network and establish strong relationships with diverse candidates and organizations to tap for future openings
  • Deliver delightful candidate experiences as measured by candidate survey data
  • Provide data-inspired recommendations to guide decision-making related to diversity recruiting strategies and goals
  • Leverage recruiting and pipeline data to identify areas of improvement in the staffing process
  • Determine effectiveness of efforts through data analysis and reporting

Requirements

  • 4+ years of sourcing or recruiting experience (or related prospecting experience)
  • Solid knowledge of business functions across GBO and G&A organizations: Sales, Marketing, Business Development, Communications, Finance, Legal, People, and Business Strategy
  • Demonstrated passion and ability to successfully identify, qualify, Â and engage diverse candidates at all skill levels
  • Working knowledge of a major applicant tracking system (Greenhouse, Jobvite, etc) and sourcing tools (LinkedIn, Connectifier, etc)
  • Ability to qualify a candidate and understand what each candidate brings to the table, and then connect that candidate with the right opportunity at Dropbox
  • Exceptional teamwork and multitasking skills
  • Must thrive and prioritize in a constantly changing environment
  • Bachelor's degree highly preferredÂ

description.__cdata: Team DescriptionMarketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights and maximize our productâs potential. Â The EMEA Marketing team focuses on the local execution of our strategy and operating plans and is structured around the following disciplines; Â in-country field marketing, business and product marketing, customer insights & intelligence, customer references/use cases and local content creation/thought leadership.Role DescriptionDropbox is used by over half a billion people around the world to be more productive in their work and personal lives. Â Product marketing (PM) is responsible for planning and executing initiatives to drive growth and increased awareness and consideration of Dropbox in key markets - in this case the EMEA Region. Partnering with product, sales, engineering and other teams across the company, the EMEA PM Lead will determine regional positioning, develop the local strategy and co-ordinate the execution of key launches and initiatives that push our brand and business forward. Â The role will focus across all markets from SMB through to Enterprise. Â A critical function of the role will be to represent the region at the corporate level, influencing the strategy and direction of product campaigns and moments.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and execute regional launch plans for new product initiatives, working closely with global product marketing, product management, engineering, PR, design, support and sales. Campaigns should ultimately drive trial and consideration of our paid for products e.g Pro/Business/EnterpriseWork both internally (with Customer Experience CX teams) and externally to conduct user, market and competitive research to better understand and evangelize market trends and apply key learnings to new initiativesIterate on the value proposition for Dropbox and articulate use cases and value in all customer facing messaging - you need to be a great story teller!Bridge the gap between Product Marketing and Business Marketing campaignsDevelop a consistent methodology for measuring the impact of campaigns and initiatives at the local level (e.g. Trial, ACV, Brand Awareness, Leads etc).Drive awareness and consideration of Dropbox through multi-channel campaigns (driving targeting, positioning, messaging, creative and launch)Partner with regional PR on product launches and campaigns and act as a local product spokesperson for DropboxRequirements7+ years of Product Marketing or Product Management experience (preferably in a SAAS environment)Experience in a product related role at the regional levelProven ability in influencing and driving non-reporting teamsExperience in developing campaigns at scale (SMB) through to more focused initiatives (Enterprise)Exceptional prioritization and project management skillsA creative mindset and the ability to take corporate programs and campaigns and develop further within the region for maximum impactExperience interpreting competitive analysis, customer segmentation and other data setsExcellent communications skills: Â written, verbal and visualHave the ability to work in a matrixed environment and understand the importance of interdependency within a team environmentDemonstrated ability to work closely with product, PR, design and sales teamsSelf-starter and ability to build programs from scratchExperience in managing agencies

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights and maximize our productâs potential. Â The EMEA Marketing team focuses on the local execution of our strategy and operating plans and is structured around the following disciplines; Â in-country field marketing, business and product marketing, customer insights & intelligence, customer references/use cases and local content creation/thought leadership.

Role Description

Dropbox is used by over half a billion people around the world to be more productive in their work and personal lives. Â Product marketing (PM) is responsible for planning and executing initiatives to drive growth and increased awareness and consideration of Dropbox in key markets - in this case the EMEA Region. Partnering with product, sales, engineering and other teams across the company, the EMEA PM Lead will determine regional positioning, develop the local strategy and co-ordinate the execution of key launches and initiatives that push our brand and business forward. Â The role will focus across all markets from SMB through to Enterprise. Â A critical function of the role will be to represent the region at the corporate level, influencing the strategy and direction of product campaigns and moments. Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Develop and execute regional launch plans for new product initiatives, working closely with global product marketing, product management, engineering, PR, design, support and sales. Campaigns should ultimately drive trial and consideration of our paid for products e.g Pro/Business/Enterprise
  • Work both internally (with Customer Experience CX teams) and externally to conduct user, market and competitive research to better understand and evangelize market trends and apply key learnings to new initiativesÂ 
  • Iterate on the value proposition for Dropbox and articulate use cases and value in all customer facing messaging - you need to be a great story teller!
  • Bridge the gap between Product Marketing and Business Marketing campaignsÂ 
  • Develop a consistent methodology for measuring the impact of campaigns and initiatives at the local level (e.g. Trial, ACV, Brand Awareness, Leads etc).
  • Drive awareness and consideration of Dropbox through multi-channel campaigns (driving targeting, positioning, messaging, creative and launch)
  • Partner with regional PR on product launches and campaigns and act as a local product spokesperson for DropboxÂ 

Requirements

  • 7+ years of Product Marketing or Product Management experience (preferably in a SAAS environment)
  • Experience in a product related role at the regional level
  • Proven ability in influencing and driving non-reporting teams
  • Experience in developing campaigns at scale (SMB) through to more focused initiatives (Enterprise)
  • Exceptional prioritization and project management skillsÂ 
  • A creative mindset and the ability to take corporate programs and campaigns and develop further within the region for maximum impactÂ 
  • Experience interpreting competitive analysis, customer segmentation and other data setsÂ 
  • Excellent communications skills: Â written, verbal and visual
  • Have the ability to work in a matrixed environment and understand the importance of interdependency within a team environmentÂ 
  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with product, PR, design and sales teams
  • Self-starter and ability to build programs from scratch
  • Experience in managing agenciesÂ

Collaborating with the partnerships, product, and sales organizations, channel marketing managers set the strategy and positioning of channel and technology partner programs, drive insights from the existing partner ecosystem, develop to-partner and through-partner messaging, and manage events/campaigns to maximize program potential. Team Description
Â 
Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights, and maximize our products' potential.
Â 
Role Description
Â 
Weâre looking for an exceptional channel marketing leader with the experience necessary to plan and execute initiatives that will drive global growth of Dropbox channel programs. Collaborating with the partnerships, product, and sales organizations, channel marketing managers set the strategy and positioning of channel and technology partner programs, drive insights from the existing partner ecosystem, develop to-partner and through-partner messaging, and manage events/campaigns to maximize program potential. With the expectation to strongly impact global strategy for the company's partner program, partner marketing managers must have the skills to succeed in a fast-paced startup environment and drive team execution on a variety of tasks.
Â

  • Drive awareness of the Dropbox Partner Network through in-person events, webinars, digital campaigns, co-marketing initiatives and other marketing-related activities
  • Own the partner readiness strategy for reseller and integration partner programs and develop/maintain partner-related training materials
  • Develop through-partner marketing campaigns that partners can easily leverage in their demand generation efforts
Â 
Requirements
  • 5+ years channel marketing, product marketing or partner marketing experience on an EMEA scope, with at least 1â2 years of direct interaction with distributors, DMRâs, VARâs or MSPâs. Experience with cloud services or SaaS a plus
  • Project management skills: can prioritize high impact activities and keep complicated projects moving forward, working across cross-functional teams
  • Track record of effectively delivering multiple and innovative projects in a fast-moving environment
  • Ability to influence wide audiences at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies.
  • Analytical skills and the ability to develop market insights, marketing strategy and analyze marketing effectiveness and ROI.
  • Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, and visual
  • Fluent in English
  • Eligibility to work in E.U.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Every Dropboxer plays a key role in helping us find and recruit amazing people, and our recruiting team leads the charge by coordinating these efforts. Itâs no easy task to identify and attract the top talent in the world, but when you have the support of the entire company, itâs incredibly fun and rewarding. Thatâs what makes recruiting at Dropbox special.
Â 
Weâre looking for a world class Engineering Recruiting Lead to join our growing recruiting team. This role will be a "player-coach,â owning select requisitions for a range of positions across our Engineering Organization as well as leading and mentoring a small team of full-cycle recruiters. If youâre a team player with an eye for talent who loves connecting people and opportunities, this is the role for you!
Â 
Responsibilities
  • Source, recruit, and hire Dropboxers across a wide range of roles across our Engineering Organization including but not limited to Product Security, Product Platform, SRE, Infrastructure Manager, Software Engineer (Release, Infrastructure, Security)
  • Manage a team of full-cycle Engineering recruiters to deliver excellent performance, develop their recruiting expertise, and facilitate their professional development
  • Partner with Senior Leaders across the Engineering organization to understand their hiring objectives and develop team recruiting strategies to hit goals
  • Drive process efficiencies to scale Engineering hiring across US based offices
  • Consistently generate a healthy pipeline of high quality candidates by driving initiatives across branding, events, and employee referral channels.
Â 
Requirements
  • 5+ years of full-cycle technical recruiting experience (in-house tech experience preferred)
  • Recruiting management experience, with proven leadership ability to develop employees and maximize individual and team performance
  • Experience sourcing and closing profiles ranging from Junior to Management positions
  • Relentless drive to find and connect with the best talent
  • Ability to qualify a candidate and understand what each candidate brings to the table, as well as connect that candidate with the right opportunity at Dropbox
  • Ability to connect and effectively communicate with people of all levels
  • Exceptional teamwork and multi-tasking skills
  • Must thrive and prioritize in a constantly changing environment
  • Bachelor's Degree

We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.Role DescriptionAs an Enterprise Account Executive, youâll help our Fortune 500 prospects understand the power of Dropbox Business. With over 400 million people and 4 million businesses trusting Dropbox with their most treasured information, weâre growing quickly and are just getting started. Youâll join a talented team focused on one thing: using technology to simplify peopleâs lives. Weâre looking for smart, ambitious people who are passionate about revolutionizing the way people work. linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

As an Enterprise Account Executive, youâll help our Fortune 500 prospects understand the power of Dropbox Business. With over 400 million people and 4 million businesses trusting Dropbox with their most treasured information, weâre growing quickly and are just getting started. Youâll join a talented team focused on one thing: using technology to simplify peopleâs lives. Weâre looking for smart, ambitious people who are passionate about revolutionizing the way people work. Weâre building the next great technology company, and we need world-class talent to achieve our vision.

Responsibilities

  • Build strong, long-lasting relationships with Fortune 500 clients and executives
  • Navigate through complex sales cycles in a competitive industry
  • Present the value of Dropbox Business and our services to C-level executives
  • Evangelize the Dropbox vision through product demonstrations, field marketing events, and account-specific initiatives
  • Construct, forecast, and manage your sales activity and pipeline to meet revenue targets and company goals

Requirements

  • 6+ years experience in B2B software sales (preferably Enterprise Content Management, Document Management)
  • Successfully sold software into Fortune 1000 companies
  • Carried and hit quota of >$1.0M (consistent top 20% performer)
  • Closed complex sales cycles in competitive markets
  • Avid Dropbox user and a vocal technology evangelist

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

As an Enterprise Account Executive, youâll help our Fortune 500 prospects understand the power of Dropbox Business. With over 400 million people and 4 million businesses trusting Dropbox with their most treasured information, weâre growing quickly and are just getting started. Youâll join a talented team focused on one thing: using technology to simplify peopleâs lives. Weâre looking for smart, ambitious people who are passionate about revolutionizing the way people work. Weâre building the next great technology company, and we need world-class talent to achieve our vision.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Build strong, long-lasting relationships with Fortune 500 clients and executives
  • Navigate through complex sales cycles in a competitive industry
  • Present the value of Dropbox Business and our services to C-level executives
  • Evangelize the Dropbox vision through product demonstrations, field marketing events, and account-specific initiatives
  • Construct, forecast, and manage your sales activity and pipeline to meet revenue targets and company goals

Requirements

  • 6+ years experience in B2B software sales (preferably Enterprise Content Management, Document Management)
  • Successfully sold software into Fortune 1000 companies
  • Carried and hit quota of >$1.0M (consistent top 20% performer)
  • Closed complex sales cycles in competitive markets
  • Avid Dropbox user and a vocal technology evangelist

description.__cdata: Team beschrijvingOns sales team deelt zijn enthousiasme over Dropbox Business met grote enterprise klanten over de wereld om ze te laten kennismaken met de kracht welke Dropbox kan brengen. In deze rol wordt je onderdeel van een gedreven team van salesprofessionals welke op een empathische wijze de wensen van een enterprise klant centraal stellen. Belangrijk hierbij is de focus op het begrijpen hoe we onze klant effectiever kunnen laten samenwerken.Hoe ziet je rol er uitDeze rol is gestationeerd in ons hagelnieuwe kantoor in Amsterdam en richt zich op de verkoop van Dropbox Business aan Enterprise klanten in de gehele BeNeLux regio. Voor deze functie zijn we specifiek op zoek naar mensen die ervaring hebben in de verkoop van software aan grote organisaties. Ben jij die door de wol geverfde sales professional wiens hart sneller gaat kloppen bij de gedachte jouw klant te ondersteunen in zowel practische als strategische vraagstukken rond sneller en beter samenwerken met Dropbox? Â Dan komen we graag met jou in contact!VerantwoordelijkhedenBouw als Ã©Ã©n van de eerste Enterprise Sales mensen mee aan het succes van Dropbox vanuit het nieuwe kantoor in Amsterdam.Manage het volledige salesproces: Van het bouwen van awareness en het genereren van leads, tot en met het sluiten van dat grote contract en de opvolging erna.Bouw en onderhoud je pipeline binnen de aan jou toegewezen verticale markten / accounts. Ondertussen verder werkende aan je strategische relaties met de beslissingsnemers en verwante beÃ¯nvloeders zoals IT managers, CIOs en CFOâs. Jouw focus is om steevast je kwartaal- en jaardoelstelling te behalen en zo bij te dragen aan de Dropbox bedrijfsdoelstellingen.Je hebt een ijzeren discipline in de opvolging van al je activiteiten, telefoontjes of andere verkoopondersteunende activiteiten en resultaten in Salesforce.Middels inspirerende product demoâs ben je instaat je enthousiasme en je kennis van Dropbox Business over te brengen of dat nu over de technische- of juist inspirationele as is.Daarnaast ben je altijd bereid een handje te helpen bij andere voor Dropbox belangrijke activiteiten zoals lead generatie, het geven van presentaties, assistentie in het onderhandelingsproces, maar bv ook in het rekruteren van andere, nieuwe Dropbox collegaâs.Idealiter bezit je een diepgaande kennis van Dropbox Business en het competitieve landschap in de BeNeLux.Je bent de stem van de klant richting onze interne organisatie en het product team.Wat we vragenJe hebt meerdere jaren ervaring in persoonlijke verkoop bij Enterprise klantenJe bent aantoonbare succesvol in het drijven van new business projecten bij flagship accounts. Consistent in het over-scoren van je targets en daarnaast ben je in staat om lange termijn relaties op te bouwen met je klanten in een verscheidenheid van markten.Je hebt ruimschoots ervaring opgedaan in de B2B internet of SaaS markt in de BeNeLux.Terwijl je focust op het resultaat, help je aan het bouwen van een wereldwijde sales engine en probeer je nieuwe processen. Je bent kritisch, bezit sterke analytische vaardigheden, maar bent daarnaast ook een geboren probleemoplosser.Je bent op je best in een compact team, en werkt graag met anderen samen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om relaties te bouwen over landsgrenzen heen en door de gehele Dropbox organisatie.Je voelt je thuis in een snel veranderende, uitdagende maar zeker ook inspirerende omgeving.Gepassioneerd Dropbox gebruiker en daarnaast een vocale technologie evangelist.Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands, Frans is gewenst.Enterprise Account Executive-BeNeLuxTeam Description - Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.Role DescriptionThis role will be based in our brand new Amsterdam office and will be focused on bringing Dropbox Business to enterprise customers across the BeNeLux region. Weâre looking for people with experience selling software to large businesses to join our team. If youâre a seasoned sales professional whoâs excited about driving key strategic and operational initiatives to help enterprises work better and faster using Dropbox, weâd love to talk!ResponsibilitiesBe one of the first Enterprise Sales on the ground in our new Amsterdam officeManage the full sales cycle, from building awareness and generating leads closing large dealsBuild and manage a sales pipeline across the assigned territory/accounts while growing successful, long-lasting relationships with decision makers and influencers (IT managers, CIOs, executives, etc.) to consistently meet quarterly and annual revenue targets and company goals.Manage, track, and report all sales activities and results with Salesforce.Deliver awe-inspiring product demos, provide insightful technical answers, and recommend creative ways to get the most out of Dropbox Business.Help scale processes including lead generation, presentation, negotiation, recruiting, and more.Develop deep understanding of Dropbox Business and BeNeLux competitive landscape.Be the voice of the customer to the product team.RequirementsYearsof client-facing sales experience.Proven track record in acquiring new accounts and winning flagship accounts. Consistently exceeding sales targets, cultivating long-lasting relationships with clients across a multitude of industries.Current experience selling into the BNL B2B market. Prior experience at Internet or SaaS companies. (highly preferred)Results driven while able to try new processes and iterate to scale a global sales engine. Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.Team player with excellent collaboration skills to build relationships across the company.Desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging and exciting environment.Ability to work into a scrappy environment.Avid Dropbox user and a vocal technology evangelist.Eligibility to work in the EU.Fluent in Dutch.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team beschrijving

Ons sales team deelt zijn enthousiasme over Dropbox Business met grote enterprise klanten over de wereld om ze te laten kennismaken met de kracht welke Dropbox kan brengen. In deze rol wordt je onderdeel van een gedreven team van salesprofessionals welke op een empathische wijze de wensen van een enterprise klant centraal stellen. Belangrijk hierbij is de focus op het begrijpen hoe we onze klant effectiever kunnen laten samenwerken.
Â 

Hoe ziet je rol er uit

Deze rol is gestationeerd in ons hagelnieuwe kantoor in Amsterdam en richt zich op de verkoop van Dropbox Business aan Enterprise klanten in de gehele BeNeLux regio. Voor deze functie zijn we specifiek op zoek naar mensen die ervaring hebben in de verkoop van software aan grote organisaties. Ben jij die door de wol geverfde sales professional wiens hart sneller gaat kloppen bij de gedachte jouw klant te ondersteunen in zowel practische als strategische vraagstukken rond sneller en beter samenwerken met Dropbox? Â Dan komen we graag met jou in contact!
Â 

Verantwoordelijkheden

  • Bouw als Ã©Ã©n van de eerste Enterprise Sales mensen mee aan het succes van Dropbox vanuit het nieuwe kantoor in Amsterdam.
  • Manage het volledige salesproces: Van het bouwen van awareness en het genereren van leads, tot en met het sluiten van dat grote contract en de opvolging erna.
  • Bouw en onderhoud je pipeline binnen de aan jou toegewezen verticale markten / accounts. Ondertussen verder werkende aan je strategische relaties met de beslissingsnemers en verwante beÃ¯nvloeders zoals IT managers, CIOs en CFOâs. Jouw focus is om steevast je kwartaal- en jaardoelstelling te behalen en zo bij te dragen aan de Dropbox bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
  • Je hebt een ijzeren discipline in de opvolging van al je activiteiten, telefoontjes of andere verkoopondersteunende activiteiten en resultaten in Salesforce.
  • Middels inspirerende product demoâs ben je instaat je enthousiasme en je kennis van Dropbox Business over te brengen of dat nu over de technische- of juist inspirationele as is.
  • Daarnaast ben je altijd bereid een handje te helpen bij andere voor Dropbox belangrijke activiteiten zoals lead generatie, het geven van presentaties, assistentie in het onderhandelingsproces, maar bv ook in het rekruteren van andere, nieuwe Dropbox collegaâs.
  • Idealiter bezit je een diepgaande kennis van Dropbox Business en het competitieve landschap in de BeNeLux.
  • Je bent de stem van de klant richting onze interne organisatie en het product team.

Wat we vragen

  • Je hebt meerdere jaren ervaring in persoonlijke verkoop bij Enterprise klanten
  • Je bent aantoonbare succesvol in het drijven van new business projecten bij flagship accounts. Consistent in het over-scoren van je targets en daarnaast ben je in staat om lange termijn relaties op te bouwen met je klanten in een verscheidenheid van markten.
  • Je hebt ruimschoots ervaring opgedaan in de B2B internet of SaaS markt in de BeNeLux.
  • Terwijl je focust op het resultaat, help je aan het bouwen van een wereldwijde sales engine en probeer je nieuwe processen. Je bent kritisch, bezit sterke analytische vaardigheden, maar bent daarnaast ook een geboren probleemoplosser.
  • Je bent op je best in een compact team, en werkt graag met anderen samen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om relaties te bouwen over landsgrenzen heen en door de gehele Dropbox organisatie.
  • Je voelt je thuis in een snel veranderende, uitdagende maar zeker ook inspirerende omgeving.
  • Gepassioneerd Dropbox gebruiker en daarnaast een vocale technologie evangelist.
  • Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands, Frans is gewenst.

Enterprise Account Executive - BeNeLux

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

This role will be based in our brand new Amsterdam office and will be focused on bringing Dropbox Business to enterprise customers across the BeNeLux region. Weâre looking for people with experience selling software to large businesses to join our team. If youâre a seasoned sales professional whoâs excited about driving key strategic and operational initiatives to help enterprises work better and faster using Dropbox, weâd love to talk!

Responsibilities

  • Be one of the first Enterprise Sales on the ground in our new Amsterdam office
  • Manage the full sales cycle, from building awareness and generating leads closing large deals
  • Build and manage a sales pipeline across the assigned territory/accounts while growing successful, long-lasting relationships with decision makers and influencers (IT managers, CIOs, executives, etc.) to consistently meet quarterly and annual revenue targets and company goals.
  • Manage, track, and report all sales activities and results with Salesforce.
  • Deliver awe-inspiring product demos, provide insightful technical answers, and recommend creative ways to get the most out of Dropbox Business.
  • Help scale processes including lead generation, presentation, negotiation, recruiting, and more.
  • Develop deep understanding of Dropbox Business and BeNeLux competitive landscape.
  • Be the voice of the customer to the product team.

Requirements

  • YearsÂ of client-facing sales experience.
  • Proven track record in acquiring new accounts and winning flagship accounts. Consistently exceeding sales targets, cultivating long-lasting relationships with clients across a multitude of industries.
  • Current experience selling into the BNL B2B market. Prior experience at Internet or SaaS companies. (highly preferred)
  • Results driven while able to try new processes and iterate to scale a global sales engine. Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills.
  • Team player with excellent collaboration skills to build relationships across the company.
  • Desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging and exciting environment.
  • Ability to work into a scrappy environment.Â 
  • Avid Dropbox user and a vocal technology evangelist.
  • Eligibility to work in the EU.
  • Fluent in Dutch.

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

As a Solutions Architect for our enterprise sales teams, youâll play a huge role in helping companies understand the value of Dropbox Business. Itâll be your mission to demystify technology, optimize the sales process, and bash down any technical barriers that keep our customers from evaluating and adopting Dropbox.

Responsibilities

  • Know every detail of Dropbox Business (including our third-party integrations), and understand how enterprise solutions are managed and secured
  • Support the Direct Sales team with technical product knowledge and objection handling in customer meetings, with travel as required
  • Work closely with Engineering, Product, and Account Management teams to ensure smooth prospect-to-customer transitions and long-term customer success
  • Help the Sales team move toward closing by making customer product trials a positive experience
  • Respond to technical questions in RFIs and RFPs

Requirements

  • You have a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, engineering, information systems, or other technical major
  • You have outstanding communication skills that enable you to converse easily with everyone from end users to C-level executives
  • You have a deep understanding of computing systems and principles particularly around the delivery of hosted services
  • You have at least 7-10+Â years of enterprise software or SaaS experience in a technical pre-sales role with a demonstrated track record of success
  • You have a strong desire to learn in a rapidly growing and dynamic startup environment

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow weâre bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.

Role Description

Our Sales team shares Dropbox for Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Act as the subject matter expert for all aspects of Distributor Operations with Dropbox.
  • Manage the launch plan for all new products into our Channel and 1-Tier Partners
  • Execute the Launch of new SKUs and products with our distributors globally.
  • Leverage Distributors to train and support our Partners as an extended sales force to help accelerate global growth.
  • Build, develop, and maintain relationships with key stakeholders to optimize departmental effectiveness.
  • Responsible for all aspects (design, launch, execution, analysis, etc.) of extended customer support through Distributors, and aligning with our CX team.
  • Accountable for high quality, compliant, end to end program optimization and documentation of all processes supporting investments and payouts.
  • Ensure timely and accurate delivery to SLA by partnering with peers and stakeholders.
  • Proactively identify and manage risks and issues, while maintaining a strong focus on escalation and milestone management.
  • Assist with preparation of business performance updates/presentations for the Channel Chief.

Requirements

  • You have 5+ years of Global Program Management or Project management experience, 5+ years of relevant business experience within Channel Operations or Distribution management.
  • Youâre fluent core systems & tools (SFDC, HIVE).Â 
  • Youâre a strong end to end thinker with the ability to develop enterprise-wide global processes and solutions.
  • You understand and can articulate theÂ cloud business model and the industry trends and metrics that surround it.
  • You have strong analytical and business modeling skills.
  • You thrive in a startup environment and can be proactive in solving problems in and outside of your area.
  • You have US work authorization.

title.__cdata: Global Distribution Operations Manager-Channel Sales MBA (2017)
