linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

The finance team is responsible for establishing our financial infrastructure and strategy. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to help Dropbox scale its global brand and continue on a best-in-class trajectory.

Role Description

The Global Infrastructure Accounting ManagerÂ will be a key member of the Accounting Operations team and will be hands on coordinating the companyâs world-wide infrastructure, real estate, and fixed asset processes. Additionally, this hire will be key in developing policies and procedures that support cross functional teams for current global operations.Â 
Â 
This full-time role will interface daily with internal departments and upper management and the ideal candidate is detail-orientated and enjoys working in a fast-paced, high growth environment.
Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Manage infrastructure and fixed asset team members in San Francisco, CAÂ 
  • Manage the career development of your staff and other professionals across the finance organization.
  • Manage Dropboxâs infrastructure, real estate and fixed asset processes related to monthly close, analytics and reporting
  • Develop and monitor the compliance of capitalization and purchasing policies
  • Work closely with financial planning and tax departments on internal reporting
  • Coordinate with supply chain teams on the purchasing and tracking of racks, servers, networking equipment, and furniture for multiple datacenters
  • Participate in legal contract reviews related to real estate and datacenters
  • Drive the development of strategies to improve accounting operations effectiveness, including the development and execution of organizational, process and system changesÂ 
  • Assist with financial audit preparation/support, including footnote disclosures
  • Preparation for Sarbanes Oxley compliance
  • Ad hoc projects as necessary

Requirements

  • CPA with 5â10 yearsâ experience in accounting with a mix of both a public accounting firm and top tier tech companyÂ 
  • Leadership and people-management skills
  • Top performer that is willing to dive into the details, and looking to gain experience and grow with DropboxÂ 
  • Advanced knowledge of US GAAP including operating and capital leases, asset capitalization, and asset retirement obligations Â 
  • Ability to build strong relationships with internal and external business partners
  • Detail-oriented with great organizational skills, but comfortable with ambiguityÂ 
  • Execution focused with the ability to take individual responsibility for delivering quality work in a timely manner
  • Strong communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with all areas and levels of the company

description.__cdata: Responsibilities:Lead business development, business negotiation and relationship management with payment processing & technology service providersPartner closely with Product and Engineering teams to help identify and prioritize upcoming platform needs, select vendors, and launch new payment options; in addition to Treasury, Tax, Legal and Trust/ComplianceDefine, track, analyze, influence, communicate and be responsible for key payments metrics, e.g., payments success and subscription auto-renewal rate, cost of payment processingPrioritize and build business case for expansion of payments capabilitiesJob requirements:Flexible, creative and strategic thinker with the ability to define business tradeoffs, generate out-of-the-box solutions and manage uncertaintyStrong quantitative abilities and intuition, exceptional business analytical skillsExcellent project management ability, capable of leading multiple time-sensitive cross-functional projectsAble to work with internal stakeholders to get to consensus on important issuesExperience working and negotiating with external business partners and vendorsExcellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and presentation skills and the proven ability to influence and communicate effectivelyDetailed understanding of the global payments ecosystem, particularly card paymentsProfile/background:7+ years experience managing a regional or global payments portfolio at a large scale, including North America and Europe3+ years experience optimizing the performance of card payments, with a track record of improving metrics through experimentation and managing quantitative analystsExperience with payments in subscription and/or B2B business models strongly preferredBA/BS degree or higher required, preferably in business, economics or finance

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Responsibilities:

  • Lead business development, business negotiation and relationship management with payment processing & technology service providers
  • Partner closely with Product and Engineering teams to help identify and prioritize upcoming platform needs, select vendors, and launch new payment options; in addition to Treasury, Tax, Legal and Trust/Compliance
  • Define, track, analyze, influence, communicate and be responsible for key payments metrics, e.g., payments success and subscription auto-renewal rate, cost of payment processing
  • Prioritize and build business case for expansion of payments capabilities
Â 
Job requirements:
  • Flexible, creative and strategic thinker with the ability to define business tradeoffs, generate out-of-the-box solutions and manage uncertainty
  • Strong quantitative abilities and intuition, exceptional business analytical skills
  • Excellent project management ability, capable of leading multiple time-sensitive cross-functional projects
  • Able to work with internal stakeholders to get to consensus on important issues
  • Experience working and negotiating with external business partners and vendors
  • Excellent written and oral communication, interpersonal and presentation skills and the proven ability to influence and communicate effectively
  • Detailed understanding of the global payments ecosystem, particularly card payments
Â 
Profile/background:
  • 7+ years experience managing a regional or global payments portfolio at a large scale, including North America and Europe
  • 3+ years experience optimizing the performance of card payments, with a track record of improving metrics through experimentation and managing quantitative analysts
  • Experience with payments in subscription and/or B2B business models strongly preferred
  • BA/BS degree or higher required, preferably in business, economics or finance

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Role Description

Weâre looking for a Growth Manager, focused on nurturing existing users, for Dropbox. This person would be responsible for optimizing the life cycle experience for users after purchase. The ideal candidate can leverage marketing and growth tactics to improve renewal and engagement metrics, is comfortable with A/B testing, and has experience executing campaigns across various channels (e.g. web, email, mobile) to drive user retention, engagement, and monetization.Â 

Responsibilities

  • Optimize retention and other key performance metrics; work with Growth & Monetization, Product Marketing, Product Management, and Design teams to ship improvements
  • Analyze data to monitor health of the subscriber base (e.g. renewal rates and volumes, key demographics & trends, etc.) and identify areas for improvement
  • Prioritize opportunities for improvement; generate data-driven hypotheses that inform strategies for campaigns and initiatives
  • Manage execution of A/B tests across emails, web, mobile, and other customer-facing commuinication platforms
  • Conduct post-experiment analyses and present recommendations and findings from test data

Requirements

  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong analytical skills. Proficiency in SQL or Hive preferred
  • Experience with A/B testing
  • Ability to work cross-functionally and manage various stakeholders
  • Core understanding of subscription products and self-service sales preferred

Â 

At Dropbox, weâre dedicated to building a home for peopleâs most important stuff, and helping them bring that content to life. More than 500 million people around the world â from individuals to small teams and large enterprises â trust Dropbox with their most treasured information and memories, uploading over 1 billion files every day. We're building the next great technology company, and weâre just getting started. Â

Role Description

Weâre looking for a Growth Marketing Manager to focus on optimizing the Dropbox post-purchase experience. Â In this role, you will be responsible for the strategy, execution, and analysis of programs aimed at driving engagement and monetization for Dropbox customers. You will partner closely with the Marketing, Product, and Design teams to launch campaigns across multiple channels, including web, in-product, and email.

Responsibilities

  • Lead the testing, development, and execution of programs aimed at improving user engagement and driving monetization for Dropbox customers; partner closely with Growth, Marketing, Product, and Design to launch and optimize campaigns

Requirements

  • Experience building and optimizing customer engagement programs in a fast-paced B2C or B2B company
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Strong project management skills: ability to manage cross-functional stakeholders, prioritize high impact activities and keep complex projects moving forward
  • Experience with customer lifecycle management (e.g., upsell, cross-sell, retention) preferred

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.
Â 
Our sales team shares Dropbox with businesses of all sizes around the world and helps them understand the power Dropbox offers to teams at scale. We're a collaborative, consultative and empathetic sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.
Â 
This a high-impact role within a priority market and we are looking to hire a smart, driven, high-caliber individual who is passionate about tech and works best in a fast-paced environment to build out and run strategy on the East Coast.Â 
Â 
The Head of East Coast SalesÂ is responsible for leading a team of Account Executives, specific to Enterprise Sales. The sales teams are responsible for assigned quotas achieved through a defined number of Enterprise accounts.Â 

Responsibilities

  • Build and lead a regional Enterprise Sales team in developing and executing on a strategic plan for the territory. Grow Enterprise customers and prospects in the region, while continuing to build out brand awareness on the East Coast
  • Assist and coach Account Executives in all phases of the selling process to achieve agreed-upon targets and performance metrics
  • Develop and implement best practices to maximize pipeline creation, customer conversion rates, forecasting accuracy, and cross-functional collaboration
  • Serve as leadership sponsor to large accounts and help drive key executive relationships
  • Strong thought leadership within the global sales team and vis-a-vis marketing team
  • Foster a culture of progressive personal development and mentoring Dropboxâs future sales leaders
  • Regularly interact with customers, partners, and integratorsÂ 
  • Operational excellence in the day-to-day management of the business including (but not limited to) forecasting, pipeline development, training, certifications, hiring, performance management, collaboration, teamwork, and best practice sharingÂ 
  • Initiate, develop and maintain executive level relationships and drive sales activities with key customersÂ 
  • Understand target customer's business needs, develop proposals and accurately articulate Dropboxâs value proposition at the executive levelÂ 
  • Assist and close complex, multi-million dollar transactionsÂ 

Requirements

  • 10+ years of sales experience, and 3+ years of sales management experience, with a history of overachieving targets in a market leading technology organization
  • Experience selling enterprise software in a highly competitive environment with a track record of sales success managing a sales organization within a Fortune 1000 technology organizationÂ 
  • Proven success scaling out an Enterprise Sales team with success selling SaaS and cloud solutions in the industry
  • Territory management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to continuously increase effectiveness of team, recognizing opportunities for creating new systems, structures, and processes
  • Strong knowledge of Salesforce reporting and dashboards, and highly focused on numbers and process
  • Proven track record working in a high-volume environment
  • Strong executive presence - experience and comfort level working with C-level executives at Commercial companies

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Legal team is responsible for ensuring safety, security, and setting global policies, and helps keep our users and their stuff safe. We protect Dropbox, counsel Dropboxers on challenging problems, and stay in sync with other teams here.

Role Description

As the Head of Litigation and Regulatory, youâll counsel the company on a wide range of issues. Entrepreneurial by nature, youâll have immediate impact with your analytic rigor, uncanny judgment, effective counseling, great people skills and ability to get things done. Â If you are a person with user-driven instincts who loves a challenging, team-focused, and fast environment, then this is the place for you!
Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Take responsibility for all litigation and regulatory matters across the globe
  • Lead a team of passionate Dropboxers who respond to government data requests and requests to remove content from Dropbox
  • Guide litigation strategy from start to finish
  • Be a passionate advocate for Dropbox usersÂ 
  • Provide strategic counseling on complex legal issues, including issues related to data privacy and security
  • Work closely with our product counsel team on a wide manner of legal issuesÂ 
  • Run internal projects, trainings, processes, and drive cross-functional effortsÂ 
  • Exhibit excellent judgment around risk managementÂ 

Requirements

  • 10+ years experience, with at least some in-house legal experience in a relevant setting
  • JD, admitted to the California Bar, distinctive academic and professional record
  • In-depth experience with and real passion for laws affecting online services (e.g., IP law, global privacy law, data security law, Section 230(c), ECPA, constitutional law)
  • Real-world experience counseling technology companies on novel legal issues
  • Demonstrated leadership and talent-development skillsÂ 
  • Sweats the details, organized, and able toÂ drive complex projects to conclusionÂ 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable navigating complicated, sensitive, and nuanced issues
  • High integrity, strong ethics, and an unflappable demeanor
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a dynamic team environment

Team DescriptionÂ 

Dropbox is the home for your most important stuffânow we're bringing it to life with a growing family of products. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people around the world.

Our sales team shares Dropbox with businesses of all sizes around the world and helps them understand the power Dropbox offers to teams at scale. We're a collaborative, consultative and empathetic sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

This a high-impact role within a priority market and we are looking to hire a smart, driven, high-caliber individual who is passionate about tech and works best in a fast-paced environment to build out and runÂ Mid Market Sales from our Sydney office.Â 

The Head of Mid Market Sales is responsible for leading a team of Mid Market Account Executives. Â The sales teams are responsible for assigned quotas achieved through a defined number of Mid Market accounts.Â 

Role Description

This a high-impact role within a priority market and we are looking to hire a smart, driven, high-caliber individual who is passionate about tech and works best in a fast-paced environment. If this sounds like you, then weâd love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

  • Lead a regional Mid MarketÂ sales team in developing and executing on a strategic plan for the territory. Grow Mid MarketÂ customers and prospects in the region.
  • Manage and grow a team of Mid Market Account Executives in all phases of the selling process to achieve agreed-upon financial targets and performance metrics
  • Develop and implement best practices to maximize pipeline creation, customer conversion rates, forecasting accuracy, and cross-functional collaboration
  • Foster a culture of progressive personal development and mentoring Dropboxâs future sales leaders; drive recruitment efforts
  • Serve as leadership sponsor to Mid market accounts and help drive key executive relationships; support the team with C-level interactions and in closing complex deals
  • Regularly interact with customers, partners, and integratorsÂ 
  • Drive operational excellence in the day-to-day management of the business including (but not limited to) forecasting, pipeline development, training, certifications, hiring, performance management, collaboration, teamwork, and best practice sharingÂ 
  • Strong thought leadership within the Sydney leadership team

Â 

Requirements

  • 15+ years of sales experience, and 5+ years of sales management experience
  • History of overachieving targets in a market leading technology organization
  • Proven success scaling out an Mid Market Sales team with success selling SaaS and cloud solutions in the industry
  • Territory management experience
  • Demonstrated ability to continuously increase effectiveness of team, recognizing opportunities for creating new systems, structures, and processes
  • Ability to identify, develop, grow young talent
  • Strong knowledge of CRM reporting and dashboards, and highly focused on numbers and process
  • Proven track record working in a fast-paced and collaborative environment

description.__cdata: Role DescriptionAs we build a foundation for scale that enable us to grow to thousands of Dropboxers, weâre looking for a Head of Technical Recruiting to join our recruitingteam. linkedin_description.__cdata:
Role Description
As we build a foundation for scale that enable us to grow to thousands of Dropboxers, weâre looking for a Head of Technical Recruiting to join our recruiting team. In this dynamic, mission-critical multifaceted role, youâll help build the vision of Dropbox Technical Recruiting. Â Youâll develop a best-in-class recruiting team responsible for all talent acquisition across our Engineering, Product Management, and Design (EPD) organizations. Reporting directly to our Global Head of Recruiting, you will be responsible for further improving the capability (across sourcing, attraction, assessment, and selection) of our technical recruiting organization, delivering talent needs Â across EPD functions.Â 
Â 
Responsibilities
  • Responsible for leading ourÂ EPD recruiting team with knowledge of software engineering, infrastructure engineering (serving/analytics, product platform, security, corporate infrastructure), product design and product management.
  • Lead, mentor, and develop a team of 20+ technical recruiters and recruiting coordinators.
  • Partner with the Senior Strategic Sourcing leader to build and maintain inclusive, highly effective technical sourcing.
  • Establish a robust, scalable processes while ensuring incredible client and candidate experience. Operationalize strategies to emphasize global scale, speed, quality and diversity of hires, innovative hiring strategies, process efficiency, and client management and candidate satisfaction.
  • Demonstrate leadership and advisory capabilities to achieve strategic and operational goals for the organization across all aspects of talent assessment, acquisition and on-boarding. Develop and implement disruptive operating models that align with future talent acquisition trends and business needs.
  • Manage and influence complex partners and senior executive relationships to ensure overall business objectives are met. Collaborating with leaders across EPD, People, and Finance, lead annual headcount planning and staffing resource planning processes for a complex and high-growth business.
  • Partner closely with our People team to directly align technical recruiting efforts with our Talent Management Strategy and EPD business goals.Â 
  • Leverage analytical and operational capabilities across strategy formulation, business planning and implementation of key priorities for the talent needs of the business.
Â 
Requirements
  • 10+ years of technical recruiting and management experience.
  • Experience leading and managing teams of 10+ technical recruiting professionals.Â 
  • Experience leading talent acquisition efforts for hiring volumes of 500+
  • Clear bias for action and results. Ability to inspire action and foster a results-mindset in others.
  • Superb ability to consult, influence and manage hiring partners. Ability to drive efforts and projects through relationships and a broad knowledge base.
  • Ability to develop team members and maximize individual and team performance while maintaining a fun working environment.
  • Demonstrated personal accountability and integrity, and an ability to build long-term, productive relationships across a global business.
  • Track record of solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering significant impact as a manager and a leader.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Engineering team is crafting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Role Description

The Infrastructure Security Team is seeking highly talented security engineers to help protect the infrastructure that stores our user data. This critical role requires a deep real passion for building security-at-scale, the ability to synthesize radical solutions, and the aptitude to define new security paradigms that work in a fast-moving engineering culture.

Responsibilities

  • You will drive security engineering and architecture efforts for our production infrastructure
  • Develop methods to security-harden the Dropbox environment without diminishing productivity
  • You will build creative tools and services that detect security issues and increase our response capability
  • Provide security domain expertise on system, network, encryption, and authentication services
  • You will actively audit the infrastructure, identify security problems, and you will prioritize fixes

Requirements

  • You have a B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
  • Experience building security in a dynamic, web-scale environment
  • You have comprehensive knowledge of multiple OS platforms with strong emphasis on Linux
  • Advanced knowledge of networking protocols - TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, BGP etc.
  • You use in-depth knowledge of authentication protocols, applied cryptography, PKI and SSL/TLS
  • You have proficiency in at least one programming language (C++, Python, Java, Ruby, etc)
  • You hold knowledge of the latest attack trends, tools, and the threat landscape
  • Consistent record in which you independently drive security projects in a rapidly-changing environment
  • You have excellent communication skills on both technical and non-technical issues

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (forÂ LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. 500 million people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our design team crafts delightful experiences that make people's lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by a highly iterative design process.

The Marketing Design team is responsible for crafting microsites, landing pages, banner advertising, and e-mail marketing. They partner with our brand and marketing team to evolve and execute on marketing goals.

We are looking for an experienced Web designer to join our Marketing Design team. As part of this team you will work closely with the Web Marketing Creative Lead, Web Marketing Optimization Managers, User Research, Product Management, and Development Teams to create world-class, customer - focused, marketing experiences that drive engagement and conversion.

Responsibilities

  • You will engage in marketing strategy development and translate objectives into strategic, purposeful design.
  • Build systems that can scale communication. A project isn't just about a single asset, but about how many pieces fit together to build a strong message and build systems that can scale.
  • Able to meet multiple deadlines, prioritize work, and keep projects moving forward.
  • Remain agile, flexible, inventive, and collaborative with the ability to turn around projects on short time lines where needed.
  • You will collaborate with the broader design team to comply on branding standards and guidelines.
  • Collaborate with the marketing department, content producers, and management to refine the user experience.
  • Approach every project, big or small, with enthusiasm to create great experiences that encompasses the distinctive look and feel of Dropboxâ°'s products, communications, and identity.

Requirements

  • You have 2+ years of design work experience
  • Strong portfolio featuring a variety of design solutions, conversion marketing, landing pages, emails, marketing materials, infographics, web experiences
  • Expertise in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign
  • You have a real passion for layout, color, typography
  • Polishing and refining your work is important to you, you obsess over details and your work is pixel-perfect
  • Demonstrated ability to translate complex concepts into easy-to-understand visuals
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with others in a cross-functional team, and be able to present and explain their design ideas and decisions effectively. Must be able to prioritize and manage work to adhere to critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment
  • You use excellent communication skills, and you have the ability to articulate concepts and solutions
  • Your experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript is a plus
  • Ensure you include a portfolio link when applying

Benefits and Perks

  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401K + company match
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Legal team is responsible for ensuring safety, security, and setting global policies, and helps keep our users and their stuff safe. We protect Dropbox, counsel Dropboxers on challenging problems, and stay in sync with other teams here.

Role Description

We're building a legal team to pursue Dropboxâs mission of helping people have their stuff everywhere and share it easily, while protecting our users. Our technology, vision, and team make this a great place to impact people around the world. Â Â 
Â 
As legal counsel - corporate, youâll have a broad range of responsibilities counseling the company on issues of corporate governance, M&A, and securities law. Entrepreneurial by nature, you will have immediate impact with your analytic rigor, seasoned judgment, effective counseling and ability to get things done. If you love a challenging, team-focused, and fast environment, then this is the place for you.
Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Take accountability for important issues and decisions and see them through
  • Advise on cross-functional company projects related to governance, corporate structure, compliance, employee compensation and finance
  • Advise the Board of Directors and company management on corporate governance issues
  • Draft, negotiate and review all types of corporate agreements, including mergers and acquisitions
  • Build and manage legal processes, internal projects and trainings in conjunction with other functions and legal leads

Requirements

  • 4+ years corporate securities experience in a relevant setting (law firm private practice preferred)
  • Extensive experience with, and passionate about, corporate governance and securities law topics, US and international
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and proven ability to manage high-impact projects and deliver creative, thoughtful and business-oriented results
  • Skilled at drafting, negotiating and interpreting corporate agreements; appropriately balancing growth and risk
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and organizational skills
  • Comfortable navigating complicated, sensitive and nuanced issues
  • Guided by integrity with a sophisticated understanding, and commitment to, personal and professional ethics
  • Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well and adapt in a fast-paced high-pressure environment
  • JD, admitted to the Bar, distinctive academic record

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights, and maximize our products' potential.

Role Description

Weâre looking for an exceptional Partner Marketing Manager with a knack for planning and executing initiatives that will drive global growth of Dropbox marketing efforts with our partner ecosystem. The partner marketing manager will collaborate with members of our partner community â as well as the business development, product, and sales organizations at Dropbox â to set the strategy and lead the execution of co-marketing programs. In addition, the partner marketing manager will be responsible for developing to-partner and through-partner messaging, creating co-marketing assets and collateral, and managing marketing campaigns to maximize joint marketing potential. Partner marketing managers must have stellar communication skills and a firm grasp on how to build successful partnerships in a fast-paced startup environment.Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Conduct user, market, and competitive research to better understand Dropbox customers, technology partners and the competitive market landscapeÂ 
  • Drive awareness of the Dropox partner ecosystem through in-person events, webinars, digital campaigns, and co-marketing initiativesÂ 
  • With a set of named partners, develop co-marketing campaigns for joint lead generation, including detailed project plans that define key activities, timelines, and resource requirements needed to achieve project objectives
  • Develop and maintain partner-specific co-marketing assets and collateral for a set of named partners
  • Manage work across a matrixed organization with internal and external stakeholders to get feedback, buy-in, and manage expectations
  • Manage forecasting and administration of partner marketing development funds

Requirements

  • 5-7 years of relevant experience in partner or alliance marketing, business development, or marketing campaign strategy. Experience with cloud services or SaaS a plus
  • Highly analytical with the ability to consume, process and transform large amounts of information into actionable insights
  • Exceptional presentation and communication skills and ability to distill complex issues into structured frameworks and concrete plans

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Your role and impact

Our Tech Operations teamÂ craftsÂ the layer from which all Dropbox experiences areÂ built.Â As our user base and productÂ familyÂ continues to grow, tech operations is responsible for strengthening our foundation.

As a part of Network Reliability Engineering, you will be responsible for building, operating,Â and writing tools for the production network. In this role, you will benefit from closeÂ collaboration with engineering and serving teams.Â 

Responsibilities

  • You will keep the AS19679 production network running with an emphasis on scale and automation
  • Build software and systems to handle and monitor the network (common languages are Python and Go)
  • Work cross-functionally with serving, engineering, and development teams to maintain a highly available, highly performant infrastructure
  • You will participate in periodic on-call rotation
  • This position will require less than 20% travel

Requirements

  • You have a BA/BS degree in a relevant engineering field or equivalent practical experience
  • You hold 1-3 years of experience building, deploying, and operating production-facing networks
  • Hands-on experience with Linux systems and programming, CLI, shells, daemons, and processes
  • Working knowledge with protocols, such as BGP, ISIS, IPv6, SNMP, NetFlow,Â etc.
  • Familiarity withÂ network hardware & operating systems, such as Juniper, Cisco, Arista, etc.
  • You have experience with QOS, MPLS, and DWDMÂ [is a plus]

Â Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

track record of exceeding ambitious revenue goals/quotas in previous positions2+ years of management experience; proven leadership, mentoring, coaching and staff development skillsFirst-hand experience with SaaS indirect sales modelsSelf-motivated and innovative, with the ability to lead both directly and by influenceStrong ability to build partner relationships at both executive and operational levelsAbility to effectively and consistently engage cross functional teamsAbility to organize and prioritizeData-driven decision-maker; linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description

The North America Head of Channel Partnerships manages the team responsible for all business aspects of the North America Dropbox for Business channel partner program, with a primary focus on generating net new license revenue and improving per-partner productivity through partner sales training, partner management, and incentive program implementation.

Role Description

The North America Head of Channel Partnerships manages the team responsible for all business aspects of the North America Dropbox for Business channel partner program, with a primary focus on generating net new license revenue and improving per-partner productivity through partner sales training, partner management, and incentive program implementation.

Responsibilities

  • Build, manage and grow a channel-based partnership team (e.g., Partner Account Managers) to complement the Dropbox direct sales teams
  • Design, implement and fine-tune North America channel strategy which will help accelerate Dropbox for Business revenue growth
  • Own North America revenue responsibility for indirect sales
  • Execute new partnerships with industry-leading Resellers and Solution Providers
  • Work with marketing to drive programs and events through the channel
  • Attend and participate in sales meetings, product seminars and trade shows
  • Collaborate with Sales Leads, Marketing teams and Country Managers across the region to grow the North America channel partner ecosystem
  • Work towards attaining licenses goals and demonstrate sustained, scalable growth quarter over quarter
Â 

Requirements

  • 7+ years experience building successful Channel partnerships in a reputable software company; track record of exceeding ambitious revenue goals/quotas in previous positions
  • 2+ years of management experience; proven leadership, mentoring, coaching and staff development skills
  • First-hand experience with SaaS indirect sales models
  • Self-motivated and innovative, with the ability to lead both directly and by influence
  • Strong ability to build partner relationships at both executive and operational levels
  • Ability to effectively and consistently engage cross functional teams
  • Ability to organize and prioritize
  • Data-driven decision-maker; well-developed business and financial management skills
  • Experience with strategic planning and strategy execution
  • Experience with contracting, negotiating, and change management
  • Experience with structuring sales quota goals and revenue expectations
  • Superior interpersonal, organizational, and verbal and written communication and presentation skills
  • Passionate about Dropbox, and the role of Channel partnerships in realizing Dropbox's vision
  • Travel approximately 25% of time
  • Bachelor's degree

Â 

Â

description.__cdata: Team Description - Our Finance team is building the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand.Role DescriptionThe Oracle Reporting and BI Analyst will support the Finance organization in the development and maintenance of reporting solutions in Oracle Cloud. Â This position will report in the Business Technology team who would work closely with cross-functional teams such as but not limited to Accounting, Tax, FP&A, IT, Sales & Marketing. Â The Reporting Analyst will be responsible in developing a reliable and comprehensive Financial and Management reporting.Skills and Qualifications:Must have at least 3 years hands-on experience developing reports in Oracle on-premise, Oracle Cloud, Hyperion or similar business intelligence reporting toolData modeling and SQL Server experience requiredWorking knowledge of Essbase applications and multi-dimensional databasesExperience with Essbase Studio or Essbase Integration Services a pluExperience using Oracle Cloud Transactional OBI and Reporting Studio preferredGeneral functional knowledge of different financial processes(i.e. R2R, O2C, P2P, etc.)Experience using web and reporting servicesFamiliarity with Cloud, SaaS and integration tools preferredDemonstrate strong analytical, organization and communications skillsAbility to interact with different levels of managementResponsibilities:Designs, develops and maintain reporting products within Oracle CloudValidates source data against output to optimize report designTranslate end user requirements into reporting design specificationsPrepare and maintain technical documentationDesign, build and maintain dashboard and report prototypesAct as the primary technical resource for end users and cross-functional team members to assist in their reporting needsTroubleshoot report questions and issues in Oracle Cloud and its periphery toolsAdvocates efficient data reporting methodologies using leading best practicesProvide end-user training on applications and reporting tools

As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.The Product Analytics team is focused on using data to help make better decisions about our products. Data is a critical part of our product development process, and Product Analysts are their chief advocates. We are responsible for ensuring that data is dependable and correct, finding insights from the data, and making an impact through data-informed decisions. We work across the entire product development timeline, from early data explorations about user behavior to multivariate experiments and optimizations on mature products.Your role and impactWe are looking for Product Analysts who can jump in and make an impact quickly. Product Analysts can expect to set up and analyze A/B tests for new experimental features, generate and size opportunities to prioritize features, and define key performance metrics for the team. As this small team continues to grow there's also an opportunity to help shape and guide its expansion through mentorship and advocacy across the company. We hope you'll join us!ResponsibilitiesWorking with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging and metricsCrafting simple, dependable data pipelines and automated reporting to surface metricsIdentifying, translating, prioritizing, and informingimportant product questions with dataExploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and moreSetting up, analyzing, and promoting good practices for multivariate experimentsSynthesizing and communicating insights during the product development processEmpowering and guiding others to work effectively and efficiently with data are part of your roleWorking towards creating a data-informed culture at DropboxRequirementsDegree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis for a technology companyFluency in SQL, as well as a deep understanding of statistical analysis, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysisYou are a self-starter: You drive projects with minimal guidance and focus on high impact workStrong communicator: You effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to othersYou are a critical thinker: You are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decisionsYou work effectively with teammates and win credibility quicklyBenefits and Perks:100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is anÂ equal opportunityÂ employer.Â We are aÂ welcomingÂ place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

The Product Analytics team is focused on using data to help make better decisions about our products. Data is a critical part of our product development process, and Product Analysts are their chief advocates. We are responsible for ensuring that data is dependable and correct, finding insights from the data, and making an impact through data-informed decisions. We work across the entire product development timeline, from early data explorations about user behavior to multivariate experiments and optimizations on mature products.

Your role and impact

We are looking for Product Analysts who can jump in and make an impact quickly. Product Analysts can expect to set up and analyze A/B tests for new experimental features, generate and size opportunities to prioritize features, and define key performance metrics for the team. As this small team continues to grow there's also an opportunity to help shape and guide its expansion through mentorship and advocacy across the company. We hope you'll join us!

Responsibilities

  • Working with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging and metrics
  • Crafting simple, dependable data pipelines and automated reporting to surface metrics
  • Identifying, translating, prioritizing, and informingÂ important product questions with data
  • Exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more
  • Setting up, analyzing, and promoting good practices for multivariate experiments
  • Synthesizing and communicating insights during the product development process
  • Empowering and guiding others to work effectively and efficiently with data are part of your role
  • Working towards creating a data-informed culture at Dropbox

Requirements

  • Degree in Math, Physics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative fields
  • 3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis for a technology company
  • Fluency in SQL, as well as a deep understanding of statistical analysis, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysis
  • You are a self-starter: You drive projects with minimal guidance and focus on high impact work
  • Strong communicator: You effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others
  • You are a critical thinker: You are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decisions
  • You work effectively with teammates and win credibility quickly

Benefits and Perks:Â 

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is anÂ equal opportunityÂ employer.Â We are aÂ welcomingÂ place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

The New York City office is a small, growing, and talented team that works on impactful projects essential to Dropboxâs success. As an early member of the Dropbox NYC Design team, youâll have the unique opportunity to build critical product experiences while shaping the direction of the team and the office.

Your role and impact

At Dropbox weâre excited about the future of collaboration and are thinking about how to bring value to the way that people work together both today and ten years from now. Whether youâre working alone, collaborating with others, are in an office, or working remotely, we want to support work on your terms â no matter what you work on or how you work.

We're seeking a driven Product Designer to refine Dropboxâs simplicity and apply it to new, amazing, and appealing user experiences. You'll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form the product. Youâll use your full range of skills from product design, interaction design, and visual design to build magical experiences.

Dropbox's New York office is filled with all the tools you need, and we're looking for you to join an awesome and delightful team.

Responsibilities

  • Youâre actively involved in defining product strategy and work with your team to define and execute on both long and short-term goals.
  • Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled. You create a collaborative environment and work seamlessly with your engineering, product, writing, and research partners.Â 
  • You conceptualize and design thoughtful user experiences for web, mobile, and desktop experiences.
  • You love to learn new things and thrive off short feedback loops just as much as you love to dive into the nitty gritty details.
  • Itâs second nature for you to collaborate with teammates in San Francisco just as you would in your home office in New York.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience in product design, user experience, or designing for digital platforms
  • You see the big picture and know how to get there. You can help the team define a vision and build towards that vision in measurable increments.
  • You're experienced in product development. You know when to make tradeoffs and when to push.
  • Your design process is validation driven and uses business and customer insights to find the right solution.
  • You have experience designing elegant cross-platform digital experiences and understand how to apply both form and function within them while maintaining simplicity.
  • You thrive in a transparent and iterative design culture that shares early and often and you can communicate the thinking behind your work with designers and non-designers alike.
  • You read everything and will paste an html heart character before your first name on the next page.

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Design team crafts delightful experiences that make peopleâs lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by a highly iterative design process.

Role Description

We're seeking a driven Product Designer to refine Dropboxâs simplicity and apply it to new, amazing, and appealing user experiences. Dropbox has a bunch of projects in the pipeline, and we have an ongoing cycle of revamping our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. There are countless UX challenges and tons of pixels for you to push. We feel like we're in aÂ unique position to change the way people interact with their digital stuff. You'll be at the forefront of our efforts and be directly responsible for decisions that form the product. Youâll use your full range of skills from product design, interaction design, and visual design to build magical experiences. Dropbox's San Francisco office is filled with all the tools you need, and we're looking for you to join an awesome and delightful team.

Responsibilities

  • You're actively involved in defining product strategy.
  • Thinking in terms of design systems and making rational design decisions.
  • You obsess over details and are excited to polish until your work is pixel-perfect.
  • Constantly pushing your limits and searching for opportunities to become better.
  • Your team collaboration skills are unparalleled.
  • You thrive in an environment with short feedback loops.

Requirements

  • You're an experience whisperer, and you can distill complicated problems into simple and elegant solutions.
  • An understanding of what makes an experience good or bad is critical. You can think through user problems, find reasonable solutions, mock them up in detail, and work with engineers to build them.
  • We love making things beautiful and hope you feel the same. You have a deep understanding of composition, balance, symmetry, and white space.
  • You have a highly refined aesthetic sense and can both work within and expand the Dropbox style.
  • You're a self-starter who actively seeks ways to make the Dropbox experience both visually appealing and easy to use.
  • You look for opportunities to solve problems in unusual and innovative ways.
  • You understand the technical limitations and liberties behind your decisions and have enough chops to communicate your ideas to our engineers.
  • Experience designing for the web and understanding how to apply both form and function within it while maintaining simplicity.
  • You construct your own iconography, set your own guidelines, and build easy-to-navigate documents.
  • You read everything and will paste an html heart character before your first name on the next page.
  • You want to work on a team of the world's best software designers and engineers, building a product that you use every single day!

Benefits and Perks

  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401K + company match
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our research and design team crafts delightful experiences that make people's lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by a highly iterative user-centered design process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we're discovering needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for millions of people around the world.
Â 

Your role and impact:Â 

If you've been following Dropbox for a while, you know that we like to keep things simple. The Design team here at Dropbox has a bunch of projects in the pipeline and we're looking for awesome designers to help refine Dropboxâs simplicity and craft the way users interact, feel and love all our products. We have an ongoing cycle of revamping our entire experience across web, client, and mobile. Dropbox's San Francisco office is filled with all the tools you need, including an awesome and like-minded team.
Â 
Did you just graduate and are looking for your first full time gig? Perfect! The design team is looking to add a few fresh faces to the ranks and if youâre really pumped about design, technology and especially Dropbox, we hope youâll apply. Weâre looking at a lot of new problems that weâd love your help in solving :)Â 
Â 

Responsibilities:Â 

  • You solve for simple. You employ a systematic process for finding -- and resolving -- hidden complexities and edge cases.Â 
  • Produce work that encompasses the distinctive look and feel of Dropboxâs products, communications, and identity.
  • Think in terms of design systems and make rational design decisions.
  • You're actively involved in defining new productâs identities.
  • Work closely with other designers defining product strategy.Â 
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams such as engineering and product management.
  • Work with the team to ship design across various products
  • To improve yourself and the design team at large, you participate in team/company initiatives: design critiques, collaboration sessions.Â 
  • Able to effectively communicate technical ideas to non-technical (and technical) people

Requirements:Â 

  • Completing a bachelor's or graduate degree in December 2016 or Summer 2017
  • Interested in either interaction, visual or illustration design for products.Â 
  • Able to work in a variety of media (print, web, mobile), design for a variety of projects (apps, visual interfaces, marketing and communications)
  • Polishing and refining your work is important to you, you obsess over details and your work is pixel-perfect.
  • Whatever your tools of choice, you wield them with deft and speed

Benefits and Perks:Â 

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights, and maximize our products' potential.

Role Description

Dropbox is used by over half a billion people around the world, helping them be productive in their work and personal lives. Product marketing managers are responsible for planning and executing initiatives to drive awareness, understanding, and growth of Dropbox in key markets. Partnering with product, communications, sales, engineering, and other teams across the company, PMMs set product positioning, develop the go-to-market strategy, and own the execution of key launches and initiatives that push our brand and business forward.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Develop and execute launch plans for new product initiatives, working closely with product management, communications, engineering, design, support, and sales teams
  • Drive awareness and understanding of Dropbox through multi-channel campaigns, from strategy to launch-day execution
  • Iterate on the value proposition for Dropbox and identify use cases that resonate with our customersâthen weave both of those inputs into compelling customer-facing messaging
  • Pilot campaigns to re-engage low activity users or to educate existing users about new featuresâdesigning the campaigns, leading their execution, and evolving the campaigns based on the results
  • Coordinate user and competitive researchâboth qualitative and quantitativeâto better understand our users and competitive landscape, and then turn those results into actionable insights

Requirements

  • 2-5 years of product marketing experience
  • Exceptional prioritization, organization, and project management skills
  • Excellent communication skills: Written, verbal, and visual
  • Strong analytical skills; demonstrated capabilities executing end-to-end quantitative and qualitative customer research and effectively identifying and interpreting key findingsÂ 
  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with product, PR, design, and sales teams
  • Self-starter and ability to build programs from scratch: Must have a positive attitude and willingness to roll-up their sleeves and get things done
  • Bonus if youâve worked on lifecycle marketing initiatives

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Role Description:Â 

Weâre looking for a product and technology communications pro who is a natural storyteller. This individual will be tasked with designing and executing programs that drive awareness for the companyâs business and enterprise solutions and partnerships. Additionally, this individual will play a critical role in working with the partnerships team to translate the benefits of partner integrations into tangible takeaways for our customers and their users. This position will work closely with the partnerships team, analyst relations, product marketing, product management and corporate marketing teams to craft compelling stories about Dropbox and execute on strategies that will bring these stories to life.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and execute communications strategies, partnership news and product launches for Dropbox
  • Execute creative communication campaigns that will increase awareness of and regard for Dropbox Pro, Business and Dropbox Enterprise products
  • Drive thought leadership campaigns on security, collaboration, and other key issues
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to refine Dropbox product/technology messaging and identify key audiences, metrics, and stories that effectivelylandÂ 
  • Partner with product teams to amplify impact of new product features and launches
  • Develop media pitches, generate media coverage and cultivate Dropbox relationships with media outlets
  • Partner with external agency to drive results

Requirements:

  • 5â7 years of communications/PR experience, ideally in both agency and in-house tech company settings
  • Established relationships with industry media contacts and demonstrated success with media relations
  • Experience with partnership communications a plus
  • Experience with and passion for growing and promoting tech brands with a deep understanding of the tech industry landscape
  • Skilled at prioritizing and executing in a fast-paced environment with keen attention to detail
  • Ability to demonstrate strong writing and storytelling skill a must
  • Analytical problem-solver with exceptional written and oral communications skills
  • Team player with a demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with product, partnership and marketing teams.Â  Also has a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude, flexibility and sense of humor

description.__cdata: Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.Our Engineering team is crafting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.Your role and impactThe Security Engineering team is responsible for making sure all our products are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about security and helping us build features that will protect our users.ResponsibilitiesYou will manage Dropbox's security vulnerability bounty programYou'll conduct penetration testing, security code reviews, and architectural reviewsYou will evangelize secure coding practices across all engineering teamsYou'll work on new product features to make Dropbox users and data more secureYou will advise engineers and teams on security issues; youâ°'ll be involved with every aspect of engineering here at Dropbox!RequirementsYou have a B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experienceYou've built a strong foundation and you have in-depth technical knowledge of security engineering, authentication and security protocols, and applied cryptographyYour contributions to the security community is a huge plusYou have a real passion for security, and a practical and balanced approach to security issuesYou are independent and comfortable working in a fast-paced environmentYou use excellent communication skills, on both technical and non-technical issuesBenefits and Perks100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage401k + company matchMarket competitive total compensation packageFree Dropbox space for your friends and familyWellness ReimbursementGenerous vacation policy10 company paid holidaysVolunteer time offCompany sponsored tech talks(technology and other relevant professional topics)Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.Â 

Our Engineering team is crafting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Your role and impact

The Security Engineering team is responsible for making sure all our products are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. We are looking for engineers who are passionate about security and helping us build features that will protect our users.

Responsibilities

  • You will manage Dropbox's security vulnerability bounty program
  • You'll conduct penetration testing, security code reviews, and architectural reviews
  • You will evangelize secure coding practices across all engineering teams
  • You'll work on new product features to make Dropbox users and data more secure
  • You will advise engineers and teams on security issues; youâ°'ll be involved with every aspect of engineering here at Dropbox!

Requirements

  • You have a B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
  • You've built a strong foundation and you have in-depth technical knowledge of security engineering, authentication and security protocols, and applied cryptography
  • Your contributions to the security community is a huge plus
  • You have a real passion for security, and a practical and balanced approach to security issues
  • You are independent and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
  • You use excellent communication skills, on both technical and non-technical issues

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox Business and Dropbox Enterprise with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

You will be joining Dropbox to lead a pioneering team that is working on building a world-class Enterprise Professional Services organisation in EMEA. If you're a talented technology professional with experience leading and driving enterprise SaaS technology programs, managing teams, and transforming business workflows, then weâd love to hear from you.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Drive conversations with and influence critical customer stakeholders, including senior IT resources such as enterprise architects, to develop a program vision, key value metrics and a tactical execution plan
  • Establish and maintain trusted adviser relationships with customers from the C-level to the front line, both within IT and business units
  • Provide guidance according to established best practices on application and integration development, enterprise architecture standards, functional and technical solution architecture & design, and technical environment management
  • Develop solution architectures and work with solution developers to build and deploy custom solutions
  • Directly manage and grow an EMEA team of Business Transformation specialistsÂ 
  • Guide customers and colleagues in rationalizing and deploying emerging technologies that drive increased business value
  • Collaborate with senior sales representatives to develop statements of work and pricing proposals for services engagements

Requirements

  • BA/BS degree
  • Experience building, scaling, and leading Professional Services teams in SaaS environmentsÂ 
  • Significant Enterprise consulting experience, including implementation experience with one or more common enterprise software solutions, filling positions of increasing responsibility and management of more junior technical resources
  • Experience in implementing SaaS technologies and enterprise deploymentsÂ 
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal; ability to effectively develop materials that are appropriate for a senior level audience
  • Flexibility to travel up to 50% of the time

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description
Â 
Our Sales team shares Dropbox with Enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.
Â 
Role description
Â 
The Program Architect plays a critical role within Dropbox Enterprise Services, serving as a strategic adviser on driving change and a Dropbox product and platform expert to the company's largest, most complex enterprise customers. You will be joining a pioneering team that is working on building a world-class services organization. Program Architects formulate the program for solution delivery and serve as the primary point of contact for technical architecture, change management and program management to the customer.
Â 
Responsibilities
Â 
  • Drive conversations with and influence critical customer stakeholders, including senior IT resources such as enterprise architects, to develop a program vision, key value metrics and a tactical execution plan
  • Provide guidance according to established best practices on application and integration development, enterprise architecture standards, functional and technical solution architecture & design, and technical environment management
  • Identify and manage risk areas and commitment to seeing an issue through to complete resolution; negotiate approaches to unblock programs and address customer issues
  • Troubleshoot key customer implementation issues and demonstrate ability to drive to successful resolution
  • Recommend use of Dropbox Enterprise Services resources to customers, such as Technical Architects, Adoption Managers or Business Transformation Specialists
  • Identify and lead internal strategic initiatives to grow Dropbox Business and Enterprise solutions, leveraging teammates to achieve individual as well as team growth; serve as an active contributor to the practice knowledge and resource base; mentor, educate and enrich technical and non-technical customers, partners and colleagues.
Â 
Experience/Skills Required
  • Significant Enterprise consulting experience, including implementation experience with one or more common enterprise software solutions, filling positions of increasing responsibility and management of more junior technical resources.
  • Proven, extensive experience managing IT and/or change projects. PRINCE2, PMP or similar certification desirable.Â 
  • Experience with key areas of enterprise architecture, including integration technologies, security and identity management, and data management.
  • Light software development, scripting (Python, powershell or similar) would be a plus.Â 
  • Proven results leading and overseeing customer and/or partner success stories in the following domains: development and release management strategies, change management, partner management, and direct leadership in designing solutions that meet or exceed customer needs.
  • Exposure to or experience with the channel (VARs, MSPs, System Integrators, etc) is desirable.Â 
  • Guide customers and colleagues in rationalizing and deploying emerging technologies that drive increased business value.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal. Able to effectively develop materials that are appropriate for the audience.
  • Flexibility to travel up to 25% of the time.Â 
  • Fluent in English, another European language (German, French, Italian, Dutch) highly desirable.Â 
  • Eligibility to work and travel in EMEA.Â

Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.
Â 

Your role and impact

The Design Research team helps Dropbox see the world from other peopleâs perspectives. We employ a variety of methods to collect rich data that enable product and design teams to make better decisions for our users.Â 
Â 
We find that research has the greatest impact when tightly coupled with design decisions, so we work on interdisciplinary design teams. As a research manager youâll work across several product teams, partnering with designers, PMs, and other functions across the organization to articulate and execute the research roadmap.
Â 

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with product teams to identify research needs
  • Design, plan, and resource user research projects
  • Communicate research schedule, results, and recommendationsÂ 
  • Integrate data sources to craft strong, strategic recommendations
  • Manage, motivate, and develop a small team of user researchers
  • Advise researchers on a range of qualitative methods and a subset of quantitative methods, such as surveys
  • Adapt research team process and practices to the growing needs of the organization

Requirements

  • 5+ years of UX-related work experience
  • Broad experience with a wide variety of research methods applied across the product development process
  • Demonstrated skills for collaborating closely with other researchers, designers, product managers and engineers
  • Clear, compelling presentation and communication style

Bonus Skills

  • Advanced degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Sociology, Psychology, Business, Information Science, Computer Science (or similar)

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Â 

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â
