description.__cdata: Team Description - Our Revenue teams share Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. The Revenue Excellence and Operations team are focused on driving sales productivity by delivering insights, tools, training and processes. We are building a world-class operations organization. We are a collaborative and empathetic team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.Role DescriptionAs the Revenue Strategy Manager, you will contribute to the development and roll-out of the yearly strategic plans, define & support sales/operational processes, report on and analyze revenue and marketing trends, and work on continuous process reengineering and problem-solving. In your role, you will also take up a broad spectrum special projects ranging from market prioritization, reviewing sales territories and analyzing team performance, and maintenance and reporting on new sales enhancement process/platforms and tools. Your job will also include in-depth quantitative analysis of key Dropbox metrics with particular focus on problem solving and creation of scaled systems and processes. You will work very closely with Senior leaders in the Operations, Channel and Sales teams to quickly understand issues and implement solutions, and collaborate with internal partners across functions like Marketing, Finance, Direct Sales, and Channel.The ideal candidate is a self-starter, independent thinker, deeply analytical and detailed-oriented, but capable of working in a structured manner to thrive in ambiguity. You do not shy away from rolling up your sleeves, slicing and dicing massive sets of information, and creating solutions to problems that have not been tackled yet.ResponsibilitiesWork on high priority initiatives including (but not limited to) strategic planning, territory optimization, sales incentive design, process optimization, forecast modelingEstablish a sustainable model to measure competitive effectiveness and drive processes that can help scale measurementsPartner closely with senior leadership to develop actionable, measurable projects that accelerate sales growth and improve sales & marketing effectivenessWork closely with other team members and the business to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insight that provides performance improvementPartner with sales team on business planning, strategy and process improvement for their respective sales areasParticipate and help steer global initiatives as appropriate and ensure that global initiatives are rolled out properly to every region/sectorRequirements4 - 5 years experience as strategic project/program lead in management consulting, B2B software (ideally SaaS) or a high-growth technology firmExperience leading complex projects in a B2B sales and marketing environment, quota carrying experience highly preferredExcellent at planning and project management â ability to look ahead to meet regular deadlines and prevent last minute fire drillsStrong desire to take initiative; thrive on change and comfortable with ambiguityGood SFDC skills and ability to develop analysis based on CRM data in a scalable mannerHappy to shift from strategic thinking to rolling up your sleeves and supporting implementationFamiliar with SQL or any other form of database querying language a plus

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Revenue teams share Dropbox Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. The Revenue Excellence and Operations team are focused on driving sales productivity by delivering insights, tools, training and processes. We are building a world-class operations organization. We are a collaborative and empathetic team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

As the Revenue Strategy Manager, you will contribute to the development and roll-out of the yearly strategic plans, define & support sales/operational processes, report on and analyze revenue and marketing trends, and work on continuous process reengineering and problem-solving. In your role, you will also take up a broad spectrum special projects ranging from market prioritization, reviewing sales territories and analyzing team performance, and maintenance and reporting on new sales enhancement process/platforms and tools. Your job will also include in-depth quantitative analysis of key Dropbox metrics with particular focus on problem solving and creation of scaled systems and processes. You will work very closely with Senior leaders in the Operations, Channel and Sales teams to quickly understand issues and implement solutions, and collaborate with internal partners across functions like Marketing, Finance, Direct Sales, and Channel.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, independent thinker, deeply analytical and detailed-oriented, but capable of working in a structured manner to thrive in ambiguity. You do not shy away from rolling up your sleeves, slicing and dicing massive sets of information, and creating solutions to problems that have not been tackled yet.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Work on high priority initiatives including (but not limited to) strategic planning, territory optimization, sales incentive design, process optimization, forecast modeling
  • Establish a sustainable model to measure competitive effectiveness and drive processes that can help scale measurements
  • Partner closely with senior leadership to develop actionable, measurable projects that accelerate sales growth and improve sales & marketing effectiveness
  • Work closely with other team members and the business to further develop metrics, KPIs, and insight that provides performance improvement
  • Partner with sales team on business planning, strategy and process improvement for their respective sales areas
  • Participate and help steer global initiatives as appropriate and ensure that global initiatives are rolled out properly to every region/sector

Â 

Requirements

  • 4 - 5 years experience as strategic project/program lead in management consulting, B2B software (ideally SaaS) or a high-growth technology firm
  • Experience leading complex projects in a B2B sales and marketing environment, quota carrying experience highly preferred
  • Excellent at planning and project management â ability to look ahead to meet regular deadlines and prevent last minute fire drills
  • Strong desire to take initiative; thrive on change and comfortable with ambiguity
  • Good SFDC skills and ability to develop analysis based on CRM data in a scalable manner
  • Happy to shift from strategic thinking to rolling up your sleeves and supporting implementation
  • Familiar with SQL or any other form of database querying language a plus

title.__cdata: Revenue Strategy and Ops Manager MBA Grad (2017)

Our Engineering team is architecting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Role Description

The Security Engineering team is responsible for making sure all our products are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. We are looking for data scientists who are passionate about security and will work hand-in-hand with engineers to detect and mitigate any malicious activity on Dropbox.

  • Interest/passion for security work
  • Strong data analysis skills, capable of writing complex SQL/Hive queries
  • Machine learning skills, capable of training and evaluating machine learning models
  • Basic programming skills (understand python code and make minimal changes)

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Your role and impact

At Dropbox, brand is central to everything we do. Our technology may be complex, but interacting with it is delightfully easy. Our Brand Team champions the intangible factors that bring happiness and a feeling of magic to Dropbox users. The team includes designers, illustrators, and producers who are responsible for defining the companyâs visual language and voice. They are always pushing to find new ways to connect emotionally, build trust, and create lasting relationships with our customers.

Weâre looking for an experienced, versatile writer to be the voice of Dropbox. As Senior Copywriter, youâll be responsible for everything from landing pages to ad campaigns to product-naming. In addition to writing your own copy for high-impact Dropbox projects, youâll also supervise work done by agencies and partners. If youâre just as comfortable scrutinizing a 20-character headline as you are developing key messages for a product launch, weâd love to talk.Â 

Responsibilities

  • Write engaging, human copy for a variety of Dropbox projects
  • Oversee work by agencies on video scripts, landing pages, events, and more.Â 
  • Give feedback on writing done by other Dropbox teams
  • Collaborate with product design, marketing, and comms to evolve the way Dropbox connects with its 500 million users.Â 
  • Advocate for users while understanding product and business goals
  • Find innovative new ways to tell the Dropbox storyÂ 

Requirements

  • 5+ years copywriting or content strategy experience
  • Excellent writing and communication skillsÂ 
  • Experience writing for a global audience; technology experience preferred
  • Ability to foster strong working relationships with team members and cross-functional partners
  • A portfolio of relevant writing work (please attach samples as a cover letter OR provide a link to your online portfolio)

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

Team DescriptionÂ 

Marketing partners with teams across the company to set positioning and strategy, manage product launches, gather customer insights, and maximize our products' potential.

Role Description

Dropbox is used by over half a billion people around the world to be productive in their work and personal lives. Product marketing managers are responsible for planning and executing initiatives to drive growth and increased understanding of Dropbox in key markets. Partnering with product, sales, engineering, and other teams across the company, PMMs set positioning, develop the strategy, and own the execution of key launches and initiatives that push our brand and business forward.

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Conduct user, market, and competitive research to better understand and evangelize market trends and apply key learnings to new initiatives
  • Iterate on the value proposition for Dropbox and articulate use cases and value in all customer-facing messaging
  • Develop and execute launch plans for new product initiatives, working closely with product management, engineering, PR, design, support and sales
  • Drive awareness and understanding of Dropbox through multi-channel campaigns (driving targeting, positioning, messaging, creative, and launch)

Requirements

  • 7+ years of product marketing experience
  • Exceptional prioritization and project management skills
  • Excellent communication skills: Written, verbal, and visual
  • Experience interpreting competitive analyses, customer segmentation and other data sets
  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with product, PR, design, and sales teams
  • Self-starter and ability to build programs from scratch: be ready to roll-up your sleeves and get things done

description.__cdata: Team Description - Our Recruiting team is responsible for finding our most valuable asset: our people. We find and hire the people who will shape our product and our company.Role DescriptionWe're looking for a world class technical recruiter to join our recruiting team. Recruiters are in charge of finding great candidates and helping them envision life at Dropbox. It's the recruiter's duty to create an exceptional candidate experience throughout every stage of the interview process. Recruiters work closely with teams to make sure all of the "behind the scenes" work that needs to happen to go from an opening to a hire actually happens. If you're a team player with an eye for talent who loves connecting people and opportunities, this is the role for you.ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with teams to deeply understand hiring needsDevelop unique full cycle hiring strategies and interview criteria for each roleSource qualified candidates, review resumes, and prescreen candidates while moving interview process forward in a timely mannerOrganize and facilitate interview debriefsDrive offer approval, extension and negotiationIdentify closing strategies for offers and proactively provide candidates with the right information to help make their decision as easy as possibleManage candidates in process and provide them with a positive experiencePartner with the Onboarding team to create a smooth transition from accepting an offer to becoming a DropboxerCreate and own a flawlessly positive candidate experienceRequirements8+ years of technical sourcing or recruiting experience requiredAt least 5+ years of experience with recruiting software engineersRelentless drive to find and connect with the best talentProven track record for assessing talent beyond matching key words on a resumeProven experience in building and managing a diverse pipelineAbility to qualify a candidate and understand what each candidate brings to the table, and then connect that candidate with the right opportunity at DropboxAbility to connect and effectively communicate with people of all levelsExceptional teamwork and multi-tasking skillsMust thrive and prioritize in a constantly changing environmentBachelor's degree

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description

Our Recruiting team is responsible for finding our most valuable asset: our people. We find and hire the people who will shape our product and our company.

Role Description

We're looking for a world class technical recruiter to join our recruiting team. Recruiters are in charge of finding great candidates and helping them envision life at Dropbox. It's the recruiter's duty to create an exceptional candidate experience throughout every stage of the interview process. Recruiters work closely with teams to make sure all of the "behind the scenes" work that needs to happen to go from an opening to a hire actually happens. If you're a team player with an eye for talent who loves connecting people and opportunities, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with teams to deeply understand hiring needs
  • Develop unique full cycle hiring strategies and interview criteria for each role
  • Source qualified candidates, review resumes, and prescreen candidates while moving interview process forward in a timely manner
  • Organize and facilitate interview debriefs
  • Drive offer approval, extension and negotiation
  • Identify closing strategies for offers and proactively provide candidates with the right information to help make their decision as easy as possible
  • Manage candidates in process and provide them with a positive experience
  • Partner with the Onboarding team to create a smooth transition from accepting an offer to becoming a Dropboxer
  • Create and own a flawlessly positive candidate experience

Requirements

  • 8+ years of technical sourcing or recruiting experience required
  • At least 5+ years of experience with recruiting software engineers
  • Relentless drive to find and connect with the best talent
  • Proven track record for assessing talent beyond matching key words on a resume
  • Proven experience in building and managing a diverse pipeline
  • Ability to qualify a candidate and understand what each candidate brings to the table, and then connect that candidate with the right opportunity at Dropbox
  • Ability to connect and effectively communicate with people of all levels
  • Exceptional teamwork and multi-tasking skills
  • Must thrive and prioritize in a constantly changing environment
  • Bachelor's degree

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our Engineering team is crafting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Your role and impact

Site Reliability Engineers are hybrid systems and software engineers who are responsible and take ownership for reliability, automation, and other issues related to 'keeping the lights on' in Dropboxâs foundation. SREs are integrated within the infrastructure team, and we're looking for engineers who want to be a part of developing infrastructure software, maintaining it, and scaling it.

Come help us build a bigger and better Dropbox as a Site Reliability Engineer. You will be part of a small family within Dropbox that has a huge impact on the world.

Responsibilities

  • You will automate the server provisioning process to reduce the labor of our networking engineering and datacenter operations teams. Once we plug a new server in, it walks itself through all aspects of provisioning to join the fleet without any human involvement
  • You will build scalable infrastructure to manage metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connections
  • You will drive the company through âDisaster Recovery Testsâ, where we manually turn down pieces of infrastructure to test Dropboxâs overall resiliency to failures
  • You will design the system and processes that Dropbox engineers use to deploy their software into production
  • You will build an auto-remediation system to automatically resolve production incidents before passing them to on-call engineers

Requirements

  • You have a desire to take Dropbox even further. If these large-scale projects resonate, we'd love to learn more about you and find out if we can work together
  • You want to learn and grow with the company. We want people who know that one size does not fit all. You should bring your skills and expertise to invent unusual solutions for the problems that Dropbox is facing

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â 

Â

We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.We've developed a set of values that enables us to do this. Specifically, we write great software and sweat the details, relentlessly focus on impact, and create a harmonious culture. Creating elegant products begins with lots of prototyping and iteration to explore the problem space. It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship a reliable product that never compromises data integrity or security. Every Dropbox software release improves millions of lives, and you'll find a high petabyte-to-engineer ratio here. We're all about shipping high-leverage projects, even if they're risky or novel. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration. Trust and respect are deeply rooted in our engineering culture.If you are a new grad or intern please apply directly to that role.ResponsibilitiesBuild infrastructure to handle metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connectionsCreate a platform that is the fabric connecting over 300,000 of the world's apps, devices, and services; redefine "sync" for a mobile era (see the inaugural DBX conference for more)You will measure, optimize, and build one of industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive meaning from vast amounts of dataCraft the data and networking layers that enable rapid product innovation across Android, iOS, and mobile webPush the boundaries of OS integration on Mac, Windows, Android, iOS, and Linux. For example, on OS X we had to reverse-engineer the Finder to show current file sync status, and on Android and iOS weâ°'ve optimized JSON parsing and have built custom bitmap caches to present lightning-fast views of tens of thousands of photosEnable our users to store and share billions of memories on Dropbox, and make these experiences delightful, from our mobile photo uploaders and web albums to a host of exciting features that will launch over the next few monthsYou can help millions of businesses around the world who run on Dropbox, from your neighborhood corner store all the way up to Fortune 500 companies; Come build Dropbox Business to help teams be more productiveRequirementsA desire to take Dropbox even further. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.

Our Engineering team is architecting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

We've developed a set of values that enables us to do this. Specifically, we write great software and sweat the details, relentlessly focus on impact, and create a harmonious culture. Creating elegant products begins with lots of prototyping and iteration to explore the problem space. It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship a reliable product that never compromises data integrity or security. Every Dropbox software release improves millions of lives, and you'll find a high petabyte-to-engineer ratio here. We're all about shipping high-leverage projects, even if they're risky or novel. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration. Trust and respect are deeply rooted in our engineering culture.

If you are a new grad or intern please apply directly to that role.

Responsibilities

  • Build infrastructure to handle metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connections
  • Create a platform that is the fabric connecting over 300,000 of the world's apps, devices, and services; redefine "sync" for a mobile era (see the inaugural DBX conference for more)
  • You will measure, optimize, and build one of industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive meaning from vast amounts of data
  • Craft the data and networking layers that enable rapid product innovation across Android, iOS, and mobile web
  • Push the boundaries of OS integration on Mac, Windows, Android, iOS, and Linux. For example, on OS X we had to reverse-engineer the Finder to show current file sync status, and on Android and iOS weâ°'ve optimized JSON parsing and have built custom bitmap caches to present lightning-fast views of tens of thousands of photos
  • Enable our users to store and share billions of memories on Dropbox, and make these experiences delightful, from our mobile photo uploaders and web albums to a host of exciting features that will launch over the next few months
  • You can help millions of businesses around the world who run on Dropbox, from your neighborhood corner store all the way up to Fortune 500 companies; Come build Dropbox Business to help teams be more productive

Requirements

  • A desire to take Dropbox even further. If these large-scale projects resonate, we'd love to learn more about you and find out if we can work together.
  • Bachelor degree orÂ equivalentÂ is required for this role.

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is anÂ equal opportunityÂ employer.Â We are aÂ welcomingÂ place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

The Abuse Prevention team is responsible for building systems to detect and stop any malicious activity against the product, such as account compromise, malware, spam, phishing etc.

Â 
Creating elegant products begins with lots of prototyping and iteration to explore the problem space. We care deeply about collaboration and feedback during the iterative development process. It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship a reliable product that never compromises data integrity or security. Every Dropbox software release reaches hundreds of millions of people, and the user-to-engineer and petabyte-to-engineer ratio are very high here.

Responsibilities

As an intern, there are many different types of roles and teams that you can have an impact on. Open positions are based on team and business need. Interns at Dropbox go toe-to-toe with full-time engineers. Here are some of the things you might do:
Â 
  • On the product engineering team, youâll build delightful full-stack user experiences that solve real customer needs and drive tons of $$ for Dropbox Â - across backend, api, desktop, mobile and web.

  • Mobile engineers are Objective-C, Swift, Java and C++ wizards - they know the ins and outs of the iOS and Android SDK and can weave and bend the APIâs to their will to craft the Dropbox client experience on mobile devices. They build the software and automation that controls the hardware that runs our products, and theyâre the first line of defense when thereâs something wrong with our production infrastructure or services.

Security engineers are software engineers with a deep interest in building software that is secure yet easy to use. An interest in the shadowy computer underworld is a definite plus!

The Desktop Platform Release Engineering team is going to make the Dropbox desktop client the fastest shipping major desktop application in the world. Â

  • Experience automating release and build processes desired.

As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our Engineering team is architecting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Dropbox Seattle is a tiny but rapidly expanding engineering office currently working across Android, desktop, payments, and photos. As an early member of Dropbox Seattle Engineering, youâll have the unique opportunity to build critical product features and infrastructure while shaping the direction of the team and the office. Find out how you can help below.Â 

Your role and impact

Specifically, we write great software and sweat the details, focus on impact, and create a harmonious culture. Creating elegant products begins with lots of prototyping and iteration to explore the problem space. It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship a reliable product that never compromises data integrity or security. Every Dropbox software release improves millions of lives, and you'll find a high petabyte-to-engineer ratio here. We're daring when it comes to shipping high-leverage projects, even if they're risky or novel. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration. Trust and respect are deeply rooted in our engineering culture.

Responsibilities

  • Help millions of businesses around the world who run on Dropbox, from your neighborhood corner store all the way up to Fortune 500 companies; build Dropbox for Business to help teams be more productive
  • The infrastructure you build will handle metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connections
  • Create a platform that is the fabric connecting over 100 thousand of the world's apps, devices, and services; redefine "sync" for a mobile era (see the inaugural DBX conference for more)
  • You will measure, optimize, and build one of industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive meaning from vast amounts of data
  • Craft the data and networking layers that enable rapid product innovation across Android, iOS, and mobile web
  • Push the boundaries of OS integration on Mac, Windows, Android, iOS, and Linux. For example, on OS X we had to reverse-engineer the Finder to show current file sync status, and on Android and iOS weâ°'ve optimized JSON parsing and have built custom bitmap caches to present lightning-fast views of tens of thousands of photos.
  • You enable our users to store and share billions of memories on Dropbox, and make these experiences delightful, from our mobile photo uploader and web albums to a host of exciting features that will launch over the next few months

Requirements

  • We're looking for brilliant engineers who are hungry to take Dropbox even further. If these large-scale projects resonate with you, and you would like to strongly influence the direction and culture of our Seattle office, we'd love to learn more about you and find out if we can work together.
  • Bachelor degree orÂ equivalentÂ is required for this role.
  • If you are a graduating student, please apply to our University Grad (2017) role - we have Seattle openings within that role as well!

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is anÂ equal opportunityÂ employer.Â We are aÂ welcomingÂ place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our Engineering team is crafting a family of products that handle over a billion files a day. We take on the complexities of technology that affect everyday life, so that people can get back to living and doing their best work.

Your role and impact

The Dropbox Desktop Platform Test Infrastructure team is building out a suite of highly reliable, end-to-end automated test frameworks in support of Dropboxâs core desktop file-sync-and-share application.Â 

This is a very complex problem. Not only do we need to craft robust solutions to notoriously problematic testing challenges like non-flaky UI validation and complex concurrency and networking scenarios, we have the added challenge of implementing and supporting these solutions across the 17 OS versions the desktop client supports spanning Windows, OSX, and Linux. Â All while building intuitive testing abstractions that allow test writers to focus on the specific scenarios they care about and not working around the test framework itself.

As a Software Engineer on Test Infrastructure, you will act as a force-multiplier for desktop client development; building out stable, delightful, cross-platform test infrastructure enabling your peers to create fast, reliable, high-signal automated tests for their features. You will apply your years of experience architecting great frameworks and developer APIs to build next-generation product validation strategies.

While there are many off-the-shelf test frameworks and infrastructure, many of those solutions fall over at our scale and complexity. We are building the core validation scaffolding for all future desktop client development. Come join us!

Responsibilities

  • You will craft, document, and maintain super-reliable and fast automation tooling and frameworks.
  • Build out testÂ guard railsÂ for feature teams working on the desktop client to quickly and safely build new features on top of complex legacy code.
  • You will evangelize best processes around automated testing, CI, and release processes.
  • Drive the bar for software quality at Dropbox.

Requirements

  • Bachelor degree in CS or equivalent experience is required for this role.
  • You have strong skill with one or more general purpose programming languages; Python experience highly desired.
  • Real passion for fast, reliable, high-signal test automation.
  • You have experience extending, and ideally architecting, test harnesses and frameworks.
  • General development experience acceptable; specialized testing experience (UI automation, performance benchmarking, stress/fuzz testing, etc) highly desired.
  • Desktop or mobile development experience preferred.
  • You use excellent communication skills and have a positive, collaborative attitude.

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

Team DescriptionÂ 

Our Sales team shares Dropbox for Business with enterprises around the world, helping them understand the power Dropbox has to offer teams at scale. We're a collaborative and empathetic Sales team, focused on understanding what businesses need to work better together.

Role Description

As a Solutions Architect in our EMEA Mid Market Sales team, youâll play a huge role in helping our partners understand the value of Dropbox for Business. Itâll be your mission to to develop and support our growing list of customers, by working closely with them in , showing the value of Dropbox and addressing technical challenges.

  • Ability to work closely with end users in a consulting, services or support capability.
  • Travel as required

description.__cdata: Team Description - Our mission is to bring a magical work experience to Dropboxers. We're an internal self-guided team that brings together internal design, communication, and social engineering. Our work aims to bring the company's mission and values to life through unusual and delightful experiences. Our design solutions reflect our culture and not our product, and so we work outside of our external brand style guide. This allows us to aim higher with each new project and push our skill sets to always be experimenting aesthetically while maintaining the element of surprise.Role DescriptionWe bring delight (cupcake) to the daily lives of Dropboxers and ensure our company remains feeling small and inclusive as we scale. As a designer, you'll be translating this intangible charter into tangible, meaningful results. Working withâclientsâaround Dropbox, you'll develop ideas for how we can make this company feel great via art and design, but also have the full freedom to craft solutions in any medium and style you feel appropriate for the project.ResponsibilitiesWork with teammates and contractors to execute your visionPioneer expressions of art never before seen in workplaces, let alone the tech industryAbility toeffectively handle a variety of requestsondeadline, while being flexible to adjusting prioritiesIncorporate empathyand maintain an open awareness of the constant evolving culture of DropboxRequirements5+ years of design experienceStrong conceptual thinkerExperience in graphic design for a physical productReceptive to critique, feedback,and open communicationEmbody a versatile set of skillsIntellectually curious and learn quickly, always eager to improve and growProficient in the Adobe Creative SuiteEqually effective going solo or working with teamsPassionate, personable,and eager to meet hundreds of Dropboxers

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team DescriptionÂ 

Our mission is to bring a magical work experience to Dropboxers. We're an internal self-guided team that brings together internal design, communication, and social engineering. Our work aims to bring the company's mission and values to life through unusual and delightful experiences. Our design solutions reflect our culture and not our product, and so we work outside of our external brand style guide. This allows us to aim higher with each new project and push our skill sets to always be experimenting aesthetically while maintaining the element of surprise.

Role Description

We bring delight (cupcake) to the daily lives of Dropboxers and ensure our company remains feeling small and inclusive as we scale. As a designer, you'll be translating this intangible charter into tangible, meaningful results. Working with âclientsâ around Dropbox, you'll develop ideas for how we can make this company feel great via art and design, but also have the full freedom to craft solutions in any medium and style you feel appropriate for the project.Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Work with teammates and contractors to execute your vision
  • Pioneer expressions of art never before seen in workplaces, let alone the tech industry
  • Ability to effectively handle a variety of requests on deadline, while being flexible to adjusting priorities
  • Incorporate empathy and maintain an open awareness of the constant evolving culture of Dropbox

Requirements

  • 5+ years of design experience
  • Strong conceptual thinker
  • Experience in graphic design for a physical product
  • Receptive to critique, feedback, and open communication
  • Embody a versatile set of skills
  • Intellectually curious and learn quickly, always eager to improve and grow
  • Proficient in the Adobe Creative Suite
  • Equally effective going solo or working with teams
  • Passionate, personable, and eager to meet hundreds of Dropboxers

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Team Description

Our Recruiting team is responsible for finding our most valuable asset: our people. We find and hire the people who will shape our product and our company.

Role Description

We're looking for a world class technical recruiter to join our recruiting team. Recruiters are in charge of finding great candidates and helping them envision life at Dropbox. It's the recruiter's duty to create an exceptional candidate experience throughout every stage of the interview process. Recruiters work closely with teams to make sure all of the "behind the scenes" work that needs to happen to go from an opening to a hire actually happens. If you're a team player with an eye for talent who loves connecting people and opportunities, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with teams to deeply understand hiring needs
  • Develop unique full cycle hiring strategies and interview criteria for each role
  • Source qualified candidates, review resumes, and prescreen candidates while moving interview process forward in a timely manner
  • Organize and facilitate interview debriefs
  • Drive offer approval, extension and negotiation
  • Identify closing strategies for offers and proactively provide candidates with the right information to help make their decision as easy as possible
  • Manage candidates in process and provide them with a positive experience
  • Partner with the Onboarding team to create a smooth transition from accepting an offer to becoming a Dropboxer
  • Create and own a flawlessly positive candidate experience

Requirements

  • 8+ years of technical sourcing or recruiting experience required
  • At least 3+ years of experience with recruiting software engineers
  • Relentless drive to find and connect with the best talent
  • Proven track record for assessing talent beyond matching key words on a resume
  • Proven experience in building and managing a diverse pipeline
  • Ability to qualify a candidate and understand what each candidate brings to the table, and then connect that candidate with the right opportunity at Dropbox
  • Ability to connect and effectively communicate with people of all levels
  • Exceptional teamwork and multi-tasking skills
  • Must thrive and prioritize in a constantly changing environment
  • Bachelor's degree

linkedin_description.__cdata:
Dropbox simplifies the way people work together. Hundreds of millions of people around the world use Dropbox to work the way they want, on any device, wherever they go. As we scale our global brand, thereâs plenty of space for you to grow alongside us and simplify life for millions of people globally.

Our Design team crafts delightful experiences that make peopleâs lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by a highly iterative design process.

Your role and impact

The Dropbox design team is looking for a UX writer to create copy that's straightforward, helpful, and human. Youâll join our small group of UX writers and add to each stage of the product development processâfrom exploration through implementation. On a typical day, youâll give and get feedback in design and content critiques, observe user research, and iterate on interface copy.

Writers at Dropbox are always asking "could this be clearer?" and "could this be shorter?" We love working through complex problems and finding a way to get to simple. Weâre constantly refining our craft and our process too, shaping the way we work together across disciplines to create a wonderful user experience.

Responsibilities

  • Write and edit UX copy in the Dropbox voice and tone
  • Advocate for users while understanding product and business goals
  • Provide feedback on writing and design
  • Maintain and develop Dropbox style guidesÂ 
  • Build and scale editorial processesÂ 

Requirements

  • More than five years of professional experience as a writer, ideally with two years of UI/UX experienceÂ 
  • A portfolio of relevant writing work (*please attach samples as a cover letter, or provide a link to your portfolio)
  • Experience working with designers, engineers, and product managers
  • A gift for giving and receiving feedback with clarity and empathy
  • Demonstrated ability to write in a company's voice in different contexts
  • Comfortable juggling multiple projects at the same time
  • Passionate about punctuation and partial to puns (affection for alliteration is optional)


Benefits and Perks

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time offÂ 
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)Â 

Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure people feel supported and connected at work. Groups like Women at Dropbox, Latin@s, Black Dropboxers, and Pridebox (for LGBTQ employees and allies) are a big part of that effort.Â

description.__cdata: Role DescriptionWe are looking for a Workday Analyst with Workday experience including HCM, Absence, Time Tracking and Integrations to joinÂ our Workday team to deliver enhanced capability, employee experience and integrations. Â The role is directly accountable for configuration ofÂ Workday business processes and reportingÂ in partnership with internal and external teams running agile sprints to configure new capabilities, build/refine integrations and enable process efficiencies. linkedin_description.__cdata:
Role Description

We are looking for a Workday Lead with strong Workday experience including Core HR, Absence, Time Tracking and Integrations to lead our Workday team to deliver enhanced capability, employee experience and integrations. Â The role is directly accountable for successful delivery of all Workday projects in partnership with internal and external teams running agile sprints to configure new capabilities, build/refine integrations and enable process efficiencies. Â The role is within our People Team (HR) and leads an amazing team of Workday analysts supporting Dropboxâs growing global workforce.Â 

ResponsibilitiesÂ 

  • Lead workday team including Dropboxers and external partners in an agile environment developing user stories, prioritizing sprint plans, confirming solution recommendations, running user acceptance test and launch with thoughtful change management.
  • Manage HR, absence and time tracking processes globally, acting as an owner to ensure the process runs smoothly and any issues are resolved quickly and effectively.
  • Use agile and project management methodologies to successfully plan and deliver bi-weekly sprints with technology partner (onshore/offshore) raising issues/risks with mitigation plans
  • Create and maintain Workday strategic roadmap across HCM, Absence and Time Tracking and ensure demand is managed appropriately.
  • Ensure prompt triage and issue resolution of reported Workday issues via Zendesk
  • Provide a proactive interface between HR client groups and the Workday team to ensure effective coordination and delivery of Workday implementations
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with HRBPs and other stakeholders. Communicate team and Dropboxer feedback to leadership as appropriate.
  • Monitor and manage work and workload of team members, providing feedback or requesting additional resource support, as appropriate.
  • Navigate complex issues effectively which will require an understanding of our people systems architecture/workflows often against time sensitive deadlines.
  • Manage Workday releases which will including regression testing of current configurations, reports and integrations.

Requirements

  • 5-7 years of experience configuring or implementing Workday HCM including integrations
  • 7â10 years of experience designing HR processes and policies
  • Experience in global workplace operations program design and launches including customer service, operational efficiency measurement
  • Comfortable with ambiguity, uncertainty, and a rapidly evolving business landscape
  • Humble attitude with a willingness to shift from high-level strategic thinking to stepping in and helping to drive implementation alongside functional teams
